content:
Posted: December 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is great. It is in-depth, difficult, and overall fun. Fun fact, I actually almost donated to the project almost a year before it made the Steam Greenlight. Actually, this was the first greenlight game i'd ever approved of. I bought it as soon as i had enough money.9.5/10Pros1. Very in-depth. The prisons you play in almost feel like a real prison.2.Good DeveloperThe developer is constantly adding to the game, this game is very well-kept. I reported a bug about your character literally not being able to get out of their bed if you loaded the game in the same session you already played in, and they fixed it within two weeks.3.Wide Variation of itemsI actually had to consult the forum to get some of these ideas! Who would've thought of molten hot chocolate? not me! This game has a surprisingly accurate crafting system as well.Cons1. This game is still early accessThis game is unfinished, so if you don't like changes being made to a game while you play, it isn't for you.2. The questing system needs workThe game has a well-implemented crafting system, but sometimes you get glitched quests that don't acknowledge when you complete them. This is an issue sometimes, as i'll beat up Officer David,  and then i won't get paid. Also, duplicate quests, (i.e. bob and joe both want officer cooper beat up), means that I have to beat up officer cooper twice, beating him up once only honors one request.3.The game has a massive difficulty spike.There needs to be less of a spike between the first and second prisons. End of story.4.Duplicate ItemsA lot of items are basically the same except in crafting. For example, the screwdriver and the crowbar are identical in purpose and value. I would like to see both items work differently.Things i'd like to see1.Co-OpThis is the huge feature i'd like. Team up, or perhaps go against your friends to make escaping the same prison a new adventure.2.Prison EditorI'm aware this is a planned feature, but the sooner you add it the better.

content:
Posted: February 7, 2016
												I've played this game for a few hours, I'm gonna tell you what I think about it.Let's get the con's out of the way, shall we?- Very hard. When you try to escape, you need to make sure every guard is gone. If you want to dig your way out, you need to have a tunnel short-term. Not having and underground tunnel long-term, because everything will be gone, even your other stuff you used to escape.- Crafting is very hard, your need to find crafting recepies and you need to higher your intellect or you can't craft stuff.- Your stats increase slowely, keeping your stats at the right place is hard and requires valuable time you need to have to escape.- Guards will dislike everything you do (Not being on the right place on the right time, standing on table's, looting stuff etc.)Let's dump all the negativity and move on with the pro's:+ Very well scripted, you have different periods (You need to finish your job, have meal, train, etc.)+ This game has humour+ Very addicting (Because you fail everytime, you want to try again :P).+ Community is ok. Some immature people, some nice people.+ Missions and different ways to earn money.+ Every thing you make or do, feels rewarding.+ A lot of items.+ Workshop, all these maps are amazing.Overall: 7/10, not for everyone. If you don't like 2D games I suggest to you that you won't like this game. The con's are the reason this rating has -3 points. The game is very hard, even in the most Easy prison available.

number of helpful: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 1
												Ok... So we've got a small game with limited budget and somebody on the developer's side who's smart enough not to care. I've watched games like this crash and burn in the past, but lookie lookie, with simple objebtives, and Mod-Editor, and a ton of imagination and suddenly you got something that smells like the beginnings of a Franchise!PROS and CONS: Ok so it's simple. It's works simply. It looks simple. It feels simple. It's not, drop you jaw, beautiful, nor should it be... That would be an entirely different game, if it was. (and most likely rubbish to boot.) It IS simple but it works (and primarily because it IS just that, simple.) It's funny, frustrating, difficult to learn, and good ol' fashioned, arcade style annoyingly difficult to keep up with if you don't plan ahead for eventualities. There's tons and tons of content and there will likely be tons more, at least until somebody funds the Team for a sequel or remake (God help us, it'll be a hard hurdle to clear to make something "better" or whatever, than this nice, annoying, addictive, timeconsuming, SIMPLE little game...) The controls are a little pedestrian and a little bit of a pain to master properly, but it actually feels like that was done on purpose to give you that old arcade feeling... The physics are a bit weird, but they work, (and, no, we'll not get into the "recipes" or "blueprints" or "plans" for assorted stuff you can make to aid in your escape, it's a little harsh, and probably a far cry from reality, but, also probably, not far enough...)Overall: For a "cheap" little game, with rudimentary graphics, gameplay and little-to-no story, this is a slam-dunk. I won't be playing this constantly (not anymore. It's so damned addictive you forget the time, once you commit to escaping,) but I am sure not gonna be judging anybody who does. And I probably will be checking in once in a while to check the content, and check to see what else the dev's have planned. - There's promise here, and fingerprints of somebody who likes to play as much as they like to make games.For what I think the dev's were aiming for: I'll put it down hard 10/10. You nailed it!On a more general basis of my own preferences: 7,5/10. It doesn't blow my mind, (not that I think it was supposed to,) but DAMN is it fun. It won't be on my top ten for "Greatest Games," by any stretch of the imagination, but it will sure as hell be one of the games I WILL come back and play again, and again, and again, and again....

content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
												The Escapists is a puzzle and sandbox game which tasks you with escaping several different prisons (each getting harder than the last).I personally found this game to be very enjoyable, the game gives you plenty of ways to escape from a prison, giving the game a strong sandbox feel and high replay value. Don't expect to get out of prison on your first run fast though (unless you look at some guides), it takes a long time to find the right moment to take action, but you are rewarded with a strong sense of accomplishment once you leave the stone fortress behind.Gameplay: The Escapists has a rich and deep system of ways to escape and content within the game. As stated earlier, there is plenty of different ways to escape from a prison. I like the way they incorporated your character's stats; you have to regularly train your character's ablities (going to the exercise room, reading, etc.) to improve your capabilites and keep your stats up high. It prevents simply maxing out all your stats and leaving the prison easily. The crafting system is complex and interesting, but I find it rather annoying that you have to buy the crafting notes from inmates (when one could simply use the wiki). Combat is rather boring, as it's simply a question of who is stronger/has a better weapon. This is easily forgiven though as combat is not the aim of the game.Graphics: The graphics is a simple yet charming 2D art style. You can really see the amount of detail that went into the art.Technical: Much to my delight, I have had absolutely zero technical issues (framerate, crashing, etc) with the game so far.Music: Simple and rather bland. Most of the time it just acts as an ambience. While it's not terrible, don't expect an amazing soundtrack.Final Score: The Escapists is a rich and rewarding game that is defiantly worth your time, although it may be a bit pricey for an early access game, it defiantly already is at a stage of completion with a few small issues and improvements that could be made.EDIT: I am very happen to see the release of the prison editor and (extremely cheap) DLC for the game. Boosts my overall score to 8.8.8.8/10

												- Do you enjoy breaking walls using plastic forks? - Do you want to beat someone using a soap inside a sock as a weapon? - Do you want to rob a book from Robert in order to deliver ir to... Robert? - Do you want to be smart enough to escape thousands of prisons (workshop) but dumb enough to get caught again? - Have you had enough building prisons in Prison Architect and decided to be a inmate in them? Well, fear no more, The Escapists delivers all your needs into one simple game: Your goal is to be creative enough to escape prisons the fastest way possible, you can dig tunnels, you can do a revolution or just simply walk out using the keys, you decide! Some perks of this game are the workshop support, dlcs at a decent price, and tons of ways to beat the same maps, great devs and a good community all in all. content:
Posted: October 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								Prison Simulator in old-style. In one word: awesome.The game is playable in early access, even though has *some* game-breaking glitches (going through walls and getting stuck), but when you start playing it, you get pulled in.Day after day, you do your daily jail routine, help your mates, steal, work, beat up people, collecting materials for your ultimate goal: The Escape. It isn't easy, and you've got little time, but when (and IF) you manage to escape, the feeling is awesome. The game allows you to finish it as fast as 1 in-game day, or play for a long time and become the master of your prison, going anywhere you want and doing anything you'd ever think about. The only things, that I feel, like the game lacks now, is multiplayer and steam workshop, for maps/characters.TL;DR - Awesome game even in early access.

content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								Quite a realistic way to simulate a prison break. You fight with guards, they'll remember and beat you up everytime they see you, until they've actually beaten you up (I think this is a glitch currently). Beat up other inmates, their opinions towards you decreases . Make their opinions low enough, they'll start attack you when they see you alone in a corner. do favor for the inmates, their opinions towards you increases, and you can recruit them to join you as a gang. It feels like it's going to be a long run, not short game, as what you'd expect a prison escape simulator should be. You need to slowly build up your way in order to break out. Tools must be made yourself, and if you dig, you need to remember to flush out the dirt. And yes, there's no guarantee your toilet is functional, if you're in bad luck the toilet will just get clogged.I'm on day 24, and trying for a shawshank redemption breakout, playing cool with everyone else while silently solo planning on a breakout. We'll see

content:
Posted: October 6, 2016
												I'd highly recommend this game to people with the patience and ability to learn from your mistakes, because you will make them and you will lose all the stuff you've spent days collecting and crafting. When you get busted and lose all your stuff it can be very frustrating, but ultimately, it's your own fault. The game IS fair, its just a steep learning curve i'm guessing many of the negative reviews on here never fully climbed.This is a prison escape simulator, not a prison hardman simulator so you have to play accordingly. Sure you can just craft a weapon and go on a rampage but you'll just end up in hospital or solitary - minus your contraband.I'm making progress by keeping a low profile, following the routine, staying out of trouble and quietly going about collecting items and planning my escape, and like real prison, it's progress by inches.So if you're looking for instant gratification and think you can spend an hour or two escaping then move onto the next level - This game is probably not for you. I've been playing this game for two days straight and i'm still on the first prison.If you like a challenge and have the mental fortitude to play the long game, then i think you'd love this game as i do. Just remember boys and girls, the devil is in the detail - one small oversight can set you back days or weeks of scavaging, Brutal but fair.Best prison game i've played, and i've played - and loved - prison architech.

content:
Posted: January 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game, though it may not look like much, is much harder than one would expect. Even on the easiest prison, every move you make must be carefully calculated. You're gonna need to make sure you keep an eye on your heat to make sure you take on the more appropriate jobs. Hunting down the people selling things can be a hassle, and doesn't always end with good results in terms of buyable products. You have to be extremely careful to leave no evidence, the guards find even a small chip in the wall and it's off to solitary and reset progress. It's important to find a place to store your contraband before you overstock on it. Schedules are important, miss a day of work and you're out of work. This is a game I recommend to anybody who enjoys strategy games.

Because I'm a lazt ♥♥♥♥, that's why.The escapists is a game where you try to escape the prison, make friends with the inmates do jobs for money do favours to rain reputation and money and so on. Try to beat the guards up (no murdering tho, even if you shank them twice with your makeshift glass shank).You start off in a prison, figure out the prison routine, and do things for a few days while you start digging holes, unscrewing vent covers, and so on. Be all sneaky-beaky like.It's great fun, unfortunately the gameplay is kind of repetitive once you start getting into it (duh, it's a prison game).Full price is 17.99, I have played 16 hours so that's roughly a dollar an hour. But I got it on sale, for half price or something. So it is definitely worth it on sale.Full price? Eh... Might as well wait and play CS:GO or Dota 2 or whatever your "free to play" (costs your soul though) game that you play at the moment.

content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								Finally Early access done right.Regular updates, it already got two prison maps !Dev is posting weekly updates too.This game remembers me of the old 2d metal gear solid games.Your a prisoner and have to escape. But you have to watch your back, because the guards can get supsicious quite quickly!There are daily routines like prison job , workout , food times etcBut the fun part starts when you leave those routines and start to discover the prison. There are many areas to discover.Outside court with several job places. Inside areas with kitchen , workout rooms. And you can even visit several floors.Fun and entertaining. Everyday you discover new craft recipes and tools to make.Best thing it seems that's the job of one dude !TL;DRBasically its a blend of 2d metal gear and terraria. Sneaking mechanics with tons of craft recipes and discoveryAt that price its a steal!Edit: It got now tons of prisons. It had so many updates i cant even follow up all the prisons. I think currently it got round about five different prisons and now even a prison break race event started!So obviously still recommended and the updates are amazing :)

content:
Posted: October 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is an amazing game and it is so much fun to play.  Here's a few pros and cons that I have put together after about 18 hours of gameplay:Pros- Cheap- Multiple prisons to escape from- You get to name your character (who doesn't love that)- Controls are simple and easy to learn- The feeling of success after escaping- Early Access means that they are going to add lots of new content (YAY)Cons- Addicting- All of the other prisoners act the same- It doesn't even seem like gaurds have a pattern- Other than getting all your contraband taken away from you, going to solitary has pretty much no drawbacksI really like this game and I'm excited to see how it turns out.  Oh, I almost forgot,  YOU SHOULD BUY IT.

number of helpful: 10 of 16 people (63%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
												IF YOU DON'T READ MY REVIEW I JUST RECOMMEND YOU TO BUY "PRISON ARCHITECT" INSTEAD!!! THEY'RE STILL UPDATING THE MECHANICS AND STILL GIVING OUT BIG MONTHLY UPDATES FOR BOTH THE MAIN GAME AND ESCAPE MODE! (EDIT: Escape mode doesn't seem to get any better. Buy it anyways for the awesome prison mechanics)The game was sadly very promising before final release.They had so many plans and promises. (I'LL SAVE THE BEST FOR LAST)   What we got, was predictable AI with telltale signs of where they're going with numerous glitches.      Most gamebreaking being guards switch which way they're heading when you enter and exit inventory or other menues and prisoners getting stuck in walls indefinetly. These glitches were precent in early versions of the game and has yet to be fixed.No in-depth relation with prisoners.   They are basically a chest that needs money to give you things to dig out of prison.Escaping is not fun or original.   You do always have a shining sign with the message "EXIT HERE." You either dig your way under a wall, dig trough a wall with a fork or try to beat up guards with hot chocolate. If you get caught THE ENTIRE MAP JUST RESETS! All your hidden stowaways are magically found, broken walls fixed and holes filled by the guards because they found dirt in someone elses toilet and "tracked" it back to you. Did I mention the glitches that will never be fixed?   I mentioned AI already in the "Predictable AI".    Your inventory lags in some weird way making you have to wait about 1.5 seconds between clicking anything when you try to spamclick 3 times per second.   If you get shot by snipers the star effect sometimes sticks, even when you save and exit.    Some toilets make guards glitch when they try to unplug them. They're supposed to make that 8-bit alert sound once to signify that they have found something out of the ordinary. They're then supposed to check the contents of the toilet to make sure that no contraband is found in it and then just unplug the toilet and walk away. Instead they keep making that annoying alert noice every 2 seconds and just stand there until you quit.   Dirty spots and weeds stack on eachother and only count as one when you work as a janitor or gardener making you work extra, a thing you dont have time with.The maps are plain and the "snipertowers" are sprites of guards surrounded by a 3x3 wall.And the absolute worst thing about this game, is that they have the guts to dare to shove lackluster DLC for this UNFINISHED game down our throuts. 5 are out already ranging between 1€-2€ with more probably incoming. These are just single maps. I would be ok with this in some degree if it wasn't for the CONSTANT reminder to "BUY THE DLC!!!1!!"I checked the game today before making my final verdict of the game and the first thing I see is a pop-up menu with all the DLC that i should buy. When I clicked out of it and clicked "New Game" i got a little red notification AGAIN to buy he DLC.    Some special items are only usable in the DLC maps but they still show up in a normal DLC free save. Their paywall is even thcker than anything I've seen come out of the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of EA. Atleast their DLC mappacks containg multiple maps that are goodlooking instead of this piece of crap.   I wouldn't be angry if they were honest about their plans for DLC, because I wouldn't have touched it.TL'DR: THis game is lacking in content, is glitchy, mechanics are not even scratching the surface for an "escape from jail" game and the devs are shoving crappy DLCs down our throuts. Buy "Prison Architect" instead!

content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								Honestly, this being my first purchase on Steam kinda bummed me out, as it seemed bigger than it was originally. Then update#2 happened, I saw the easier prison, and things started to click. It's a game that lets you screw around however you want, but as time drags on you slowly start to formulate plans and ideas and start to recognize the weaknesses in the prison itself. Even though discovering things may take some time and you might be sent to solitary quite a few times, you start to understand what really matters and eventually you start to chip out ideas and plots of how you're going to escape. It's trial and error in a very pure form, and so far I'd say that this has me genuinely excited for where it goes from here. Worth every cent.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								To start this review, I'll explain what The Escapists is. This game is an 8-bit simulation type. It makes you pick a character and gives you an insight in to prison life, as well as trying to escape the prison. You follow routines in order to keep the guards off of your back.I like this game as:1. It's original. I have never seen a game like this before and I tend to recommend original or uncopied games. The routines vary from prison to prison as well as the level of security so that not everything is a doppleganger of one another.2. I find this game oddly addictive unlike some other games I have come across. I always try to escap with no avail yet I am always trying and trying again showing no signs of boredom whatsoever.3. This game is in very early stages. There are some things I dislike about this game (e.g some items are too much of a challenge to obtain) but they will probably either be fixed or changed in later versions which means that most things that need fixing or changing will be fixd and changed by the time the game is finished.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								The escapist is an 8-bit adventure game based in a prison. You are able to chose from a variety of characters at the beginning to start off your quest to freedom. The aim of the game is to escape (incase you hadn't figured it out) and there are many ways to do this. There are no hints and tips in-game to get you out. you just need to use your initiative. You can go great escape, or steal the keys and hope you can out run the bullets. To do some of these tasks you need to buy equipment from the other inmates. This obviously requires money, which you earn by doing favours. While there are only a few different types of favours in the game at this time, they always seem rewarding, whether that be money or because you punched someone in the face during showers and outran the guards, i dont know. What i do know is the monotonous of buffing up is very.. well monotonus. It doesnt take just a few days to get your strength to a good standard where you can win a fight, same for  intelligence so you can craft certain objects. Other than this, this game has so much potential and i enjoy playing!

content:
Posted: February 15, 2015
 This is a review for version 1.0, I will be updating this as the devs update the game, respectively  Overview In The Escapists, you play an unfortunate prisoner, who ends up in prison for doing simple things like murdering your family or eating all the cake in the town. As a prisoner, you go about your daily prison routine to avoid drawing suspicion from the guards, all while plotting your escape. You start out in the most luxurious of prisons, gradually advancing to crummier and more difficult ones as you escape each one. There are many different ways of escaping, and the prison life is well simulated.  Overall Rating: 7/10 A seemingly simple prison escape game that offers a lot of gameplay for very little hard drive space. It's a nice casual/strategy game to play to get away from the other games Steam has to offer. Although, like many relatively new games, could use some improvements. Price:7/10 The original price of this game in Early Access was $9.99 USD, which is what I purchased it at. Since then, the price has steadily rose due to various game expansions and improvements the developers have implemented and has settled at a reasonable $19.99 USD. Even at $20, the developers are continuing to plan and add new features, making it well worth the price. Gameplay:9/10 As I've mentioned before, this game offers a surprising amount of gameplay for the little amount of hard drive space it requires. So, in the game you play as a prisoner who has to follow the daily prison routines (rollcall, eating meals, shower, exercise period, lights out, etc). While doing so, however, you must also plot your escape, utilizing various seemingly ordinary objects (duct tape, socks, files, etc) to make the tools in which you need to escape (pickaxes, weapons, shovels, etc). You can gain those items by looting your fellow prisoners' desks or simply purchasing them with money (yes, they give money to prisoners!) There are also many methods of escape, which range from accessing the air vents, tunneling your way out, pretending to be a prison guard, and organizing a prison riot. All these keep a player entertained while enjoying the pleasures of prison life. Length: 9/10 In Early Access, there were very little guides. I had to figure out all the crafting recipes myself, figure out all the methods of escape myself, and spent many hours just learning the game. Now, in addition to the new content that the devs have provided us for the full release, you can easily rack up over 20+ hours just trying to escape all 6 prisons. That's not all, you can spend even more time trying to get the achievements, if that's what you do. Story: 4/10 In short, the stories and text in this game are mediocre. The reason I have it as 4/10 as supposed to a 1/10 is because of the witty banter. When you see a prisoner or guard or warden or staff, you often will see them saying a humorous line or two. Things like "I should drop you right here" or "My baton does the talking" or "Address me as your king" or even "Taking your wife out to dinner". I would suggest that each prisoner and guard have their own personal diary, and depending on the person and prison, they would each have their own backstory. I also suggest that you can have actual conversatiosn with other people instead of just clicking on them and having them respond. Maybe certain things you say would affect your reputation with them.  Graphics: 8/10 Nice, simple graphics and animations for a nice, relatively-simple game. I suggest that the devs should implement more detail, though. If a guard is unconscious because you whacked him with a baton, a little blood on him wouldn't hurt. Little things like that will make this game better. Music/Sound: 6/10 A lot of the sound in simple, and that complements the game well. More detailed sounds would be nice. Example: Steve pours molten chocolate on Officer Whitney. I would like to hear sizzling sound, or a scream, anything that shows that the chocolate is hot or the officer is in pain. As for the music, repetitive. I like how you have different types of music for different times of day. There's eating music, workout music, shower music, and night music. However, that gets repetitive, especially if you have to repeat the same daily routine over, and over, and over again. Have at least 3 tracks for each time of day. Also, having music unique to a specific prison would be nice.  Performance: 10/10 Performs smoothly, as expected for such a low performance-demanding game. Have found very little bugs in my time playing, which have all been minor, such as not being able to flood other prisoners' toilets, only mine. Objectives: 7/10 The main objective is good (escaping), is good for the most part. The devs are planning on adding more ways of escaping and I hope that they'll balance the methods out. For example, in the easiest prison, there are several ways of escaping, but it's not balanced at all. Method one: you just need a cutting tool and an easily crafted bed dummy to escape (which can be achieved on day one) Method two: You need to dig a tunnel until it extends past the fences (which can take many days!) See what I mean? Now, for the side-quests. In this game you can do tasks for your fellow prisoners in order to earn money. These tasks range from giving them a specific item to beating up a certain person. I'd like to be able to get another prisoner to do a task for me instead of slaving, for once. I'd also like to be able to trade items with them and sell items. It would make the system a lot more realistic and fair. World: 8/10 The prisons are unique in themselves, their layouts being different to provide a challenge to escapists. I like how you can explore between the walls of the prison and find loot. I don't like how you can just walk out of certain prisons and find no more landscape to challenge you or to explore. For example, Stlag Flucht, the second easiest prison in the game. You can simply walk out when you escape and find no more challenge. Where's the frozen tundra, or the frigid forest? That kind of detail in the world design would make it better. Characters: 6/10 I'd like to be able to customize my inmate's looks and read their backstories and interact with them like an actual person. Give them a personality in conversations; don't have every prisoners say the same thing. Make each character unique; give them a dominant hand, give them a family that visits them, give them a gang that wants to rescure them from prison, give them body types. Example: Bob may be slightly overweight, but he can take a lot of guard tower shots. Bill may be slightly underweight, but boy can he run! Also, a very simple skill tree could enhance the game a lot. Example: a point in Sprinter would allow your character to boost his speed for a short period of time. Even your fellow inmates and guards could have skill trees to balance out the game. Item Variety: 7/10 This game has a decent variety of items, some people may disagree and say this game has a lot, but I'd say decent. There are sock maces (they exist!), powered screwdrivers, fake fences, plastic key molds, flashlights, dirt, deluxe toilet rolls and so much more. The weapons I think could use some balancing. Make each weapon have its own benefits. For example: A Super Sock Mace would have a range advantage over the Hammer, which has more damage. AI: 5/10 The AI is basic, needs many improvements in my opinion. Prisoners just walk around the entire period during free time. They don't try to exercise to gain strength or speed, or read books to gain intellect. Their stats should also degrade as well, which would give them some incentive to do so. Also, have them planning their escapes, too. I would like to see other inmates escape with me.

content:
Posted: February 14, 2015
												The game is amazing, i really love it. Theres a very real sense to it. Unlike some games where its the same over and over, this is different every time. Very fun. I would give it 8/10. Here is why. The only thing i do not like, is that i get heat easily. Even when i have no illegal items. Now im trying to break out of the first prison and i have a screwdriver, no heat. But then i walked into the bathroom and boom 99 percent, snipers took me out fast. Either its bugged or someone ratted me out (which is unlikely, since i have rep over 50 with every inmate) perhaps if that was changed id give it 10/10. Also the sniper towers are too op. They do add to the realism and hardness of escpaing, but on a super easy prison that shouldnt be the case. Either way you can escape in one day super easy, heres how (on the very easy prison)You will need comb/toothbrushtoothpastetaucum powderlighter2 pillows3 pillow sheetssome form of wall breaking tool (most likely you will only have plastic knives, get exactly 4)all of those are legal, now the illegalsguard outfitany form of wall breaking tool that is better than the knivesThe pillows and sheet you can get from right clicking beds, get those and put them in your deskNext, get either a comb or toothbrush(they are inside every inmate desk, including yours)Also toothpaste, again should be in desksYou may have to knock someone out for the lighter and taucum powder,also DONT FORGET you need to rasie your strength and intel. Raise strength till you have 35 health or more. And i believe somewhere around 70 intel, maybe more, maybe lessDuring your job (you start with laundry) clean the clothes (or dont, but i reccomend you do)After you meet your qouta, get a dirty guard outfit, clean it, then equip it.Why equip it? so the detector doesnt go off when u walk out, then quickly put back on prison outfit and now you have a guard outfitGet knives from the food courtnow begin training and whatnotafter that crafting2 pillows and a sheet make a bed dummylighter and the comb or toothbrush make molten plasticpowder and toothpaste make puttyput the extra 2 sheets on your prison bars (equip it and click on the bars)now the hard partYou have to knock out a guard to find the PURPLE keyfor me, everytime you go to a set period (lunch, gym, etcc) there will be the SAME 2 gaurds, one of them has the key. I tend to pick the one that walks outside more, or is in the upper right corner, but its always one of those 3.When you knock him out, take key and begin crafting right therekey plus putty is moldmold plus molten plastic is plastic purple keyput the key back on the guard asap (if they wake up without a key they put u in solitary)now you waitat evening rollcall make sure you have the knives (4) (or another good wall breaking tool) guard outfit and key. Make sure u have the bed dummy in your bed,equip outfit and leave out the bottom doors outside (this is the only time youll use that key)next go to the right, pick a wall and beginafter some time you will get fatigued, wait a bit, then continue.boom, wall breaks you walk out and escapesnipers are not active at night.also guards might see you, if they walk near you just stop till they leave.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2015
												There are certain games that most everyone likes but just don't capture you for some reason. It's often not the fault of the game but just a bad marriage between game and gamer. So it is with me and The Escapists. To be honest, I don't get it. There's no direction, the art style is best phrased as butt-ugly and the controls aren't easy. I'm forever getting stuck on the edge of doors because you have to be lined up perfectly to get through them. I don't find the gameplay very compelling. I know what I'm supposed to do - work on your stats, get into a job that allows you to steal the components you need to escape and then do so - but I don't find it very engaging. In that I know I'm in the minority. That's ok. I'm just not good at it. The side quests are simple, the other prisoners seem to be fairly faceless, the routine dull and just the whole thing for me falls flat. I haven't even been able to escape the first prison and to tell you the truth it's not really worth my time trying. I should like it - I'm a fan of strategy - but I don't. Now again, that's just my experience. But I also know I'm not the only one. A friend of mine also bought this and felt the exact same way. In the meanwhile the reviews are very positive, so I know and accept that I'm in the minority. Yeah, if this sounds like the classic "it's not you, it's me" line, it pretty much is. I'd probably like the game much more if the controls were better, if the graphics are clearer and if the strategy was more robust. But it's not and I regret buying this one. If returns were allowed when I bought it, I would have done so. But they weren't and so it gets a thumbs down from me. YMMV.

content:
Posted: August 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is a fun game though it does get quite repetitive. From what I've  played it seems like the basis of advancing to a higher tier in game in which you are well situated and familiar with the prison is crafting which requires you to find crafting plans, guess, or look it up on a wiki (which makes the game reliant on external sources other than itself for its gameplay hence not self-sustaining). The "favors" or quests that you complete for other inmates are repetitive too as there are only two different types: A, beat someone up; or B, retrieve an item. However, there is a fun puzzle aspect to the game in figuring out how to sneak resources out from one of the three jobs you can pick as well as how to use these materials to access new areas and bypass locked doors. That being said, the worst thing in this game I would say is the leveling up system where you are literally performing menial button pressing over and over and over in order to level up and leveling up is essential as many jobs and crafting require you to have a minum level in the intellect area and you stand no chance in any type of combat (needed for the inmate quests) unless you have a high strength skill. It would be ok if you could achieve max level once and be done with it but it diminishes over time, not slowly either, so a signifigant portion of the gameplay is simply pressing q and e very fast or clicking and waiting. Being that this is an alpha build im sure these issues will be addressed, but untill then it is a decent game with some great roleplay features associated with a prison and some terrible features associated with a prison.Overall Rating - 6.75/10

content:
Posted: February 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Literally one of the best games I've ever played.You're in a prison and you have to escape, yeah, yeah, yeah. But it is  wayyyy  harder than you think. You gotta be elaborate, intelligent, and clever to escape, so you're probably not gonna escape at first. But that's what makes it so addicting. You always try to find new stuff and initiate your plan, and as soon as you start...A guard or nighttower knocks you out. You're wake up with nothing you had equipped besides the stuff in your cell desk. You rage yet start again, finding out a new plan to escape or just go on with prison life.That's what makes this game so enjoyable. There are so many different ways you can escape that once you find one, you stik to it until you fail and make another fail. It's like one big cycle that's broken once you escape. But the repeatedness isn't annoying.The music is also great too, it sets a nice ambience for each activity in the prison, and kinda funny when you're trying to beat up a guard or something and the same music just goes on.Overall,  amazing  game (considering it's still early access) by Mouldy Toof Studios, and I'd really recommend getting it. It's worth the 15 dollars.10/10

												So simple yet so much fun. Great concept, challenging gameplay and amusing dialogue from the guards and other inmates. You are dropped into the prison routine without much direction on how to escape. Read books, work out, build relationships, learn the map/routine and MacGuyver yourself some tools and weapons. There are different strategies and play styles for you to discover as you go along. The prisons are increasingly difficult and there are community-made maps and a map editor when they get boring. This game is definitely worth the price, even when it's not on sale (but it's a STEAL when it is... get it? eh?)

content:
Posted: June 30, 2015
												This game is over-the-top in gaming, and an essential to all gamers. I have so many Pros and barely any Cons. Here are mine.Pros:Really awesome gameplay, almost no lag, and amazing computer AIReally fun for players who have ever wonder what it's like in the long days of prisonersA new take on Retro graphicsYou never predict what's next (Well, except for the next Shower Block xD)And many more that I won't spoil.Cons:The only complaint of this game is the OP guards. It's almost impossible to get past them at night. Otherwise, this game is awesome.The game is amazing, and with the last of my Steam money I'm probably gonna buy the DLC. This game is so amazing, and I will tell you, if you are thinking about buying this and are reading this comment now, I'll tell you, use your extra $18. It's the best game for creative players.1000/10, This game is the essential of every Steam gamer.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								The prisons are all fun and different, the characters have some of the funniest dialogue I've seen in a video game. You play the game at your own pace, do what you want, when you want. The crafting system is great and simple, the favor system gives you things to do when your bored, or to make some extra cash. Jobs are also a thing, you can be a mailman, a janitor, and much more! You will earn a lot of enemies in prison, but maybe some friends along the way as well!The only things that are cons for me are as followed:- It will sometimes take forever to get what you need, the things people sell are most of the time just useless for what you need.- When trying to escape, if the guards find you, you are automatically caught and put in confinement without a chance to fight back, I feel that you should atleast be able to put up a fight!- The jobs "Janitor" and "Gardener" are all based off of luck, if not enough spills/weeds are around the prison, you lose your job, and sometimes it is literally impossible to complete said jobs.- I dislike that you can find the same "Crafting Note" over and over again, making most "Crafting Note" purchases worthless.- Some people dislike the workout system, of having to rapidly press "Q and E" to workout. Personally, I have no problem with it, but to some it's annoying.My review of "The Escapists:" 10/10

								This is a brilliant, cute, light-hearted game all about escaping prison. It uses the classic 8-bit graphics combined with a top-down view and fantastic gameplay features of today. It is still ridiculously fun (and funny) to play, and many adults play it.I'd suggest getting it as soon as you can. It's definitely worth the money.//Ron

content:
Posted: March 28, 2016
												So simple yet so much fun. Great concept, challenging gameplay and amusing dialogue from the guards and other inmates. You are dropped into the prison routine without much direction on how to escape. Read books, work out, build relationships, learn the map/routine and MacGuyver yourself some tools and weapons. There are different strategies and play styles for you to discover as you go along. The prisons are increasingly difficult and there are community-made maps and a map editor when they get boring. This game is definitely worth the price, even when it's not on sale (but it's a STEAL when it is... get it? eh?)

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 5, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game has exceeded my expectations greatly. The "Do it yourself" approach to escaping is brilliant. When you're thrown into prison with nothing but a few tutorials to keep you alive, escaping is entirely your job. The game won't step in and say, "You can use these materials to make a shovel." or "No guards patrol around here, so you can dig a hole in the ground to escape." It's all you. You make the plan. You watch for weaknesses in the system. You create your own tale and escape in your own way.Across two different maps, with more to be added, and with a large prison, bustling with security flaws, angry prisoners and guards, and many different tools and methods to help you escape, the Escapists will provide hours of fun, as you try various escape plans, and discover through trial and error which plans will work or not, and ultimately, will contribute to the whole "Do it yourself" approach.Run on sentence much?

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												CONS- graphics feels like $2 game;- sound feels like $2 game;- slightly annoying degrading skills, needs regular repetitive top up (but game might be too easy otherwise);- consequences of being caught not harsh enough, they just take away yr contraband;- not random gen only 9 fixed prison layouts so far, once u've worked out a prison it's quite easy but a prison editor is in the works; - leaderboard has ppl breaking out in 1 day on the easier lvls;PROS+ wickedly fun gameplay;+ great escape from prison atmos;+ good chilling music, i rarely leave game music on;+ numerous ways to escape not just one route;Don't be fooled by graphics, the devs done a great job on the gameplay. I'm totally immersed in the prison break atmos. Started digging a tunnel to freedom while everyone's working mwahahaha...balls! Guards are coming to check my room! Everything in my room is contraband!?!?!? It wasn't me!! Noooo don't put me in solitaryyyyy. If only triple AAA games put some of this effort into games.Some of the leveling up minigames are a little repetitive as they degrade over time, but the game would probably be too easy otherwise. It is an indie game so it does feel a little light in some areas, there's not a great deal of items but they are rare to come around, some of the logic is very dodgy eg, u can beat up a guard and take his gear but there isn't any harsh consequences. But it's great fun to hatch out an escape plan and literally chipping away, making sure yr timing is executed perfectly.At current price I'd probably won't recommend if not for the devs adding a prison editor (not sure if free update or dlc). The prisons feel varied enough but once u've worked one out, replayability is left upto u to escape differently.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 2, 2015
												Really, its more like Prisoner Simuator 2015, the Junior Novelization ^^And honestly, its really fun xD obviously the objective of the game is to escape, but there's a lot of RNG going on, the randomness means that any given escape attempt from the various prisons can take anywhere from a couple in-game days, to a month of planning.  Crafting is a huge cornerstone of the game (which I imagine is fairly realistic), from using a comb or toothbrush as a shiv, to using bleach to color a prisoner outfit to look like a staff uniform.  You can craft a dummy to place in your bed at nights while you dig a tunnel, there's a makeshift sailboat that has to be constructed for one map, there are fake vent covers, plastic key-copies, etc etc and you more or less have to discover what your options are by experimentation, there is an item that gives you a random recipe but you couldn't really depend on that alone. Mercifully, the game pauses while you're on the crafting screen.Largely because of the randomness, it can be difficult; for example twice each day at morning and night, the guards pick two random prisoners and search their cells for contraband; if you haven't made yourself a convenient hiding place for your stash - and properly hidden THAT, ie crafting a fake vent cover or girly poster to put over the enormous hole in the floor/wall you've dug with the tools you've also crafted - if they find contraband at any point they confiscate it, which can put you back several steps in your escape plan, as collecting all the materials you need can take so long, and require varying amounts of risk. I wish you could bribe guards with your money, or otherwise gain their favor, so far I haven't found any means of gaining favor over guards or at least getting them to look the other way (though its still a possibility, the game does very little hand-holding).If you've ever wanted to recreate the ending of Shawshank Redemption, this will do the trick for you; just without the dark tone, nobody dies in this game (only knocked out) and the only hint of sexual abuse is an achievement for dropping your soap in the shower xD that's the level of humor you can expect, though its largely G-rated. I don't think I've even seen "bad words" in the game, but it doesn't need them either unless you're wanting some HBO-level♥♥♥♥♥♥If you're interested in it, I recommend it :) Also, prison editor with Steam Workshop for user-made prisons, I didn't even realize at first, that's awesome!! There are 6 (8?) non-DLC prisons included and each is fundamentally different, so that's really good.  Also apparently Alcatraz is offered as DLC, if I ever get over my boycott I may buy that <.<

												the Escapists is hard later on but still fun. I guess it is like a RPG (role playing game), you have to grind all the time in the hardest prison which is bad but the game makes up for it by making you happy about escaping or finding the rare item that you need to craft something to help you escape which might make or brake the game for you. But you can't say its not a great feeling when you overcome something difficult. The art style is good for pixels, the top down point of view or POV is ok but not great. NPCs are cool with a like you meter as i call it it is a meter that tells you how much an NPC likes you and that will affect many things to how much discount you are given to if they will fight for you or look the other way if you beat someone up. If you do that the bar will go down a little bit they also make many references to a variety of movies, games, books and TV shows. Combat could use a better system because it is hit space and then left click once and you sit and wait it does not need to be a click click click to fight just like a power attack or quick attack would be fine and the layout of all prisons are great hugely different and detailed. this game gets a 9.0 maybe 9.4 for new update with building prisons but not many great ones yet hopefully in the future there is. Thanks for reading and i recommend this game. I guess i have zero punctuation ha ha ha

content:
Posted: July 24, 2016
												I have been eyeing this game for quite a while, in fact almost since it was initially released. I was really excited once I actually bought it. Then I played it. The game has an amazing idea, fun graphics, and a lot going for it. As you can tell by most of the reviews people like it. There are a lot of things that ruined the game for me.First off, there isn't a real tutorial. It doesn't teach you anything of real importants, in fact the tooltips throughout the game do more than the tutorial. It took me over ten minutes to figure out how to lift weights in the exercise room, and I only figured it out because I went online looking for help on a wiki. Second, many of the mechanics of the game are not very rewarding, nor very interesting. To raise your strength, you have to smash down on your a key for several hours before you can start to take on even another inmate, which leaves your finger aching and you a little frustrated. Then running to build up your movement speed is a similar situation, just a little less button mashy after you build it up during your workout. It's fun to start tunneling or exploring the vent systems, except the guards have x-ray vision and as soon as they find anything out of the ordinary it's your fault. In fact I remember one time I was just sleeping and I got caught when I had a fake vent up (Which is supposed to be fool proof by the way.) So the game mechanics weren't super well thought out, and could get a good fix. It would be awesome if the guards didn't have good vision and if you have mutliple ways you're trying to escape from, they only get rid of the one they found, or you could get other prisoner's caught for something you did, such as build a tunnel in their room while they're not in it. In other words, I would love if the game actually was more realistic, and less, you get fat overnight if you forgot to work out one day because stealing stuff and all, as well as less button mashing (bad for my fingers and potentially for my keyboard too.) and guards that weren't all seeing gods in mortal bodies. The game had a lot of potential and could have been something ground breaking, except they shortcutted through a lot of the functions, making the game more frustrating and ridiculous than immersive. If there was a reboot or update to this game to fix several of these mechanics, I would most definitely get it.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2016
												I wanted to like this game. I really did. A puzzle game about breaking out of jail? You bet! But it's a frustrating mess. If you want to play without cheating you'll spend 15-20 minutes getting all the pieces in place for your genius escape plan only to discover that NO, THE GAME DOESN'T WANT YOU TO DO THAT.This would be fine except it's quasi-rogeulike and you will spend an enormous amount of gameplay marking time until you have the opportunity to try out your idea. At this point either bad luck or horrible, illogical puzzle design will prevent you from doing so and you'll have to decide if you want to spend 20 minutes trying again or, like I did, just quit. There's no room for ingenuity, it's just trial and error. To give one example: carrying a guard's uniform through a metal detector sets it off (seriously, so does a piece of rope). Wearing that same uniform doesn't. This sort of fuzzy logic is fine if the rules are spelled out (it's a contrband detector rather than a metal detector - but you're never told that!). I assumed wearing a guard's uniform would set the alarm off, so never tried it - I only found out through a walkthrough. Oh and that guard's uniform that's invisible to the detector? The tower guards will straight up murder you if they see you wearing it -unless you wear it at night of course. Once you realise this is the level the game operates on you're essentially doing things at random to see what works. This does not make for an enjoyable gaming experience in my opinion. A promising game, poorly executed.

You'll love this game if you enjoy crafting games, puzzle games, games with good music, simple (yet surprisingly difficult) concepts in games, and a host of other reasons. This game is still in development so be warey of that as it could change, but as it is right now it's completely worth the price and you'll be sure to dump some serious hours into playing it.

content:
Posted: March 26, 2016
												This is a really fun game. Despite its low-rez graphics and simple animations, the Escapists is a fairly in-depth, interesting and complicated game which provokes strategical thinking from the player and requires you to plan your actions carefully. This game is worth playing for the feeling you get when you escape a prison!I've only beaten the first prison, but so far it is 100% worth the discounted price I payed for it, and I'm sure It's worth the full price too.Pros:-Fun-Interesting-Time-consuming-Cute graphics-It feels BLOODY AMAZING when you escape a prison!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Cons:-If you screw up it's a bit hard to get back up to were you were-Time-consuming-Wierd controls-Inconvinient save systemOverall I give this a thumbs-up, although it's probably, as with most products of this price range, worth waiting for it to go on sale.11/13 shiny and chrome razors

												I recommend this game for those who want a challenge.I am particular about what genre of game i play and whether it will last me a while, and this game definitly does.Though it is very challenging and complex, it requires quick thinking and strategy.You also have to be cautious about what you do or take ,or put away. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was slightly concerned about buying this game, but the price was reasonable and I wanted a game to play.Best. Decision. Ever. Been playing for ages, stealing from desks at breakfast and working out. It's very addictive and I can't even figure out why! But I love it. I've always liked playing prison servers on Minecraft and this is much more fun than them. Anyone who's a fan of those kinds of servers should DEFINITELY get this game.There is only one con I can think of, which is sometimes when I'm making my way to my job at the metalworks, I'll be walking down and guards will attack me for no apparent reason, even though I don't usually carry contraband. After they kill me I'll be walking back to my job and they'll be yelling at me to get back to work, which will increase my guard heat.But overall it's a great game, and it's in Early Access so there's still loads to be added. I'm exited for any further release.

								Let me start off by saying that I am a very big fan of games with pixel-graphics, so I may have some bias.The Escapists is a game where you assume the role of a prisoner with the goal of escaping the prison. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								A very interesting concept of a game. The enjoyment of planning out your whole escape in anyway you want it to be. It even has quite some challenges as you progress further into each prison. The same tactics used in previous ones can't always be used (well could, but be much more difficult), which makes the player try to find flaws in the security and use that to his/her advantage. As you spend your days in prison, you could get help from prisoners or just beat them up and take any items you need to plan your escape, heck some can even help you beat the other inmates up. This game provides quite some replay-ability (assuming you wanna find another route to leave from or how fast you can do it). There are plentiful of items in the prison, which can be used for crafting items to aid you in your efforts in busting out. The biggest thing it also allows is the challenge of sneaking out of jail as well (even though you plan your route, you don't really know the guard's patterns too well at night) by any means: Bars, guards, snipers, searchlights, fences, walls, etc. It provides quite some fun planning and going though with the escape to live a free life out of your cage. Hope you would consider this for quite some hours of fun, oh yea, NAUGHTY KIDS GO INTO SOLITARY! Don't get caught! ^_^

content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								seriously, i love this game! simulators are cool to me but most of them are made to rage or are just plain normal. that's why i love goat simulator but most importantly, that's why i love this game! it's a pretty cool game and the guards are very realistic. i've never been in jail before but i'm pretty sure the guards act almost exactly like that. the game reminds me of the shawshank redemption (soz if spelt wrong, i don't know how to spell a couple of words) and it's pretty difficult to escape when the guards are breathing on you neck. the suspense is why i love stealth games. out of all the time i've played this game (not long) i haven't dicovered any bugs or reasons to hate this game! there are a couple of things missing but not enough to well and truly hate it. that's why i have a reccomendation list for what i think this game needs.multi player: the game's AI is really good. but imagine how much fun one would have playing with ones mates.workshop support: this game really needs the ability to make your own prisons.cops and robbers mode: if you ever decide to implement multiplayer, there should be the option to become a cop.i'll let you know if any more ideas come to me.keep up with the good work! i really don't want to see this game disscontinued.

content:
Posted: February 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is ADDICTING. Such a fun little game and it's really different from anything I've ever played. The music is awesome, the gameplay itself is very fun and it makes you think without being overly complicated. The crafting system is cool and I keep learning more stuff about it the longer I play. Great as a time-waster while at work (if you can play games without getting caught) or to just play for hours on end because it's fun. You'll love this game if you enjoy crafting games, puzzle games, games with good music, simple (yet surprisingly difficult) concepts in games, and a host of other reasons. This game is still in development so be warey of that as it could change, but as it is right now it's completely worth the price and you'll be sure to dump some serious hours into playing it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 25, 2016
												The Escapist is an awesome sandbox prison game where you take the role of a prisoner that you can name and choose a look. The game provides a tutorial, three save files, six challenging prison maps to escape, four DLCs, a whole community of map makers and the tools to make your own map with the additional Escapists: Map Maker (comes along with the purchase of The Escapists)Start off with daily routine and earn cash by doing jobs for the prison or for fellow cellmates, steal from guards and cellmates, craft dozens of unique tools and weapons, break open vents, dig underground tunnels, make gangs; whatever required to escape the prison! I highly reccomend it for those who love strategic games and crafting games. I'd give it 4 Stars and a 9/10. There still are some glitches like the NPCs getting confused when you sit in a seat the bots target to sit in at lunch and some just annoying things like the player immediatly getting sent to solitary while trying to escape. (guards should just come out and find the player if they are to be caught.) Developers should fix this but those are small details that don't ruin the entire game. They have gotten annoying to me though. Anyways 4 Stars/ 9 out of 10!

content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												Day one: My name is "SoapDropper" I'm in here for varius crimes. Armed robbery, murder, vandalism. Today, I followed the routine. I was chosen for a cell search. They found a shiv that was in my desk. I didn't place it there, but yet, I was punished. Officer James will pay for this. Day two: I followed the routine today, nothing more happens. I begin saving up money. Walter is selling a crowbar. Officer James will regret crossing me. Day three: Again I followed the routine, nothing more happens. Day four: I have a crowbar. It was $30. I gave Walter many bars of soap. He likes soap. Day five: I quit my job as a laundry washing person.Day six: I wake up. Officer James is walking down the corridor. I hit him three times in the head. Blood splatters the floor, as he attempts to crawl away, I swing again, knocking him in to the blissful world of sleep. He lies in his own blood, I look down, and I smile. Revenge is mine. I loot him, and walk into the courtyard. A guard kills me. Game restarts. 46/10 with cheese -IGN

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 18, 2016
												The Escapists is a game where your goal is to escape multiple prisons. It's a strategy-game where exact and precise planning is required. Patience is also a very important part of it. You've got to have knowledge to most of the items and interact with other prisoners. You should also have a "Plan B" if the main plan does not work. When you master this the game will be funny and Thrilling. There is also an Level Editor in the game so you can make your own prison. So if you dont like games where there is much time where progress is impossible, The Escapists is not your game. Do you like Planning, Preparing and Perform hard tasks, Welcome to Prison Boy. I Highly Recommend it.10/10

content:
Posted: February 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is ADDICTING. Such a fun little game and it's really different from anything I've ever played. The music is awesome, the gameplay itself is very fun and it makes you think without being overly complicated. The crafting system is cool and I keep learning more stuff about it the longer I play. Great as a time-waster while at work (if you can play games without getting caught) or to just play for hours on end because it's fun. You'll love this game if you enjoy crafting games, puzzle games, games with good music, simple (yet surprisingly difficult) concepts in games, and a host of other reasons. This game is still in development so be warey of that as it could change, but as it is right now it's completely worth the price and you'll be sure to dump some serious hours into playing it.

content:
Posted: November 24, 2014
Early Access Review
 The Escapists After 28 hours of this game, I still haven't came anywhere NEAR escaping the prison.Countless hours of gathering contraband items, and coming very close to escaping, all of that coming down to an early room search or accidentally going past a metal detector. Graphics 8/10 The graphics aren't advanced in any way, but they are simple and it looks quite good the pixely way it is, giving it a nice feel. Gameplay 10/10It is, strangely enough, a very addictive game.You can spend countless hours playing this game, and it doesn't really get boring, with the new updates nearly every week.OverallOverall, The Escapists is a very well recommendable game. It is fun, simple to get the gist of, and most of all, not all that expensive! I very well recommend this game.9/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 18, 2016
												The Escapists is a game where your goal is to escape multiple prisons. It's a strategy-game where exact and precise planning is required. Patience is also a very important part of it. You've got to have knowledge to most of the items and interact with other prisoners. You should also have a "Plan B" if the main plan does not work. When you master this the game will be funny and Thrilling. There is also an Level Editor in the game so you can make your own prison. So if you dont like games where there is much time where progress is impossible, The Escapists is not your game. Do you like Planning, Preparing and Perform hard tasks, Welcome to Prison Boy. I Highly Recommend it.10/10

content:
Posted: April 12, 2015
												The Escapists is a simple game with a lot of charm. The first point of business it has a wide range of tools and a new artistic design on graphics the graphics have been pushed to 2D wich in my opinion gives the game a unique style. The game is as it says in the title you have 5 (and two bonus prisons) wich grow increacingley harder in difficulty, the main aim is to go about the daily routine and in the spare time buy from other inmates the tools requerd to escape in multiple ways each distinctley with there own risks and rewards. The game is a fun twist on the life of an imaate and and entertaining way to waste away a sunday afternoon as you become stressed becauce you were so close to escaping when a guard discovers youre tunnel and robs you of youre tools or the patronising dicision to either wait another day and save or to risk loosing all of youre hard erned tools. however the game lacks in the lenth as each day can be a struggle as the ever repeating time table gets werey fast and for the most part yo must follow this. there is also recentley a map editoe wich gives the players an ability to make there own prisons on the steam workshop however fun this is this is just a beta and currentley has nimerus bugs and gliches but if you persevier it is well worth the effort.overall this game is worth a 7/10 this is becauce of the repetative timetable as it gets so boaring in the later stages thanks for reading my take and i hope i have helped you in youre decision to purchase this title. please comment if there is anything i have missed thanks.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								A very interesting concept of a game. The enjoyment of planning out your whole escape in anyway you want it to be. It even has quite some challenges as you progress further into each prison. The same tactics used in previous ones can't always be used (well could, but be much more difficult), which makes the player try to find flaws in the security and use that to his/her advantage. As you spend your days in prison, you could get help from prisoners or just beat them up and take any items you need to plan your escape, heck some can even help you beat the other inmates up. This game provides quite some replay-ability (assuming you wanna find another route to leave from or how fast you can do it). There are plentiful of items in the prison, which can be used for crafting items to aid you in your efforts in busting out. The biggest thing it also allows is the challenge of sneaking out of jail as well (even though you plan your route, you don't really know the guard's patterns too well at night) by any means: Bars, guards, snipers, searchlights, fences, walls, etc. It provides quite some fun planning and going though with the escape to live a free life out of your cage. Hope you would consider this for quite some hours of fun, oh yea, NAUGHTY KIDS GO INTO SOLITARY! Don't get caught! ^_^

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 24, 2014
Early Access Review
 The Escapists After 28 hours of this game, I still haven't came anywhere NEAR escaping the prison.Countless hours of gathering contraband items, and coming very close to escaping, all of that coming down to an early room search or accidentally going past a metal detector. Graphics 8/10 The graphics aren't advanced in any way, but they are simple and it looks quite good the pixely way it is, giving it a nice feel. Gameplay 10/10It is, strangely enough, a very addictive game.You can spend countless hours playing this game, and it doesn't really get boring, with the new updates nearly every week.OverallOverall, The Escapists is a very well recommendable game. It is fun, simple to get the gist of, and most of all, not all that expensive! I very well recommend this game.9/10

content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
												Day one: My name is "SoapDropper" I'm in here for varius crimes. Armed robbery, murder, vandalism. Today, I followed the routine. I was chosen for a cell search. They found a shiv that was in my desk. I didn't place it there, but yet, I was punished. Officer James will pay for this. Day two: I followed the routine today, nothing more happens. I begin saving up money. Walter is selling a crowbar. Officer James will regret crossing me. Day three: Again I followed the routine, nothing more happens. Day four: I have a crowbar. It was $30. I gave Walter many bars of soap. He likes soap. Day five: I quit my job as a laundry washing person.Day six: I wake up. Officer James is walking down the corridor. I hit him three times in the head. Blood splatters the floor, as he attempts to crawl away, I swing again, knocking him in to the blissful world of sleep. He lies in his own blood, I look down, and I smile. Revenge is mine. I loot him, and walk into the courtyard. A guard kills me. Game restarts. 46/10 with cheese -IGN

												The escapists is a game where you break out of multiple prisons. each prison gets harder as you go on. Dont let the graphics fool you this is a fantastic and well made game. You well have to craft weapons and various tools too aid your escape. You can also buy tools from your fellow inmates. You can earn money by doing the job the prison has asigned you or you can get some quick cash by doing your inmates dirty work. You well need to keep it cool with the other prisoners or they might get angry with you and they might turn violent you also want to keep your repuation good with the gaurds becuase they can make your life misruble in the slammer. There is also DOWNLAODIBLE CONTENT in the WORKSHOP so you can always downlaod new prisons and maps if you get board. So over all i give this game a 7 out of 10 its a good game with nice game play mechanics and i highly recommend i.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
												The escapists is a game where you break out of multiple prisons. each prison gets harder as you go on. Dont let the graphics fool you this is a fantastic and well made game. You well have to craft weapons and various tools too aid your escape. You can also buy tools from your fellow inmates. You can earn money by doing the job the prison has asigned you or you can get some quick cash by doing your inmates dirty work. You well need to keep it cool with the other prisoners or they might get angry with you and they might turn violent you also want to keep your repuation good with the gaurds becuase they can make your life misruble in the slammer. There is also DOWNLAODIBLE CONTENT in the WORKSHOP so you can always downlaod new prisons and maps if you get board. So over all i give this game a 7 out of 10 its a good game with nice game play mechanics and i highly recommend i.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was slightly concerned about buying this game, but the price was reasonable and I wanted a game to play.Best. Decision. Ever. Been playing for ages, stealing from desks at breakfast and working out. It's very addictive and I can't even figure out why! But I love it. I've always liked playing prison servers on Minecraft and this is much more fun than them. Anyone who's a fan of those kinds of servers should DEFINITELY get this game.There is only one con I can think of, which is sometimes when I'm making my way to my job at the metalworks, I'll be walking down and guards will attack me for no apparent reason, even though I don't usually carry contraband. After they kill me I'll be walking back to my job and they'll be yelling at me to get back to work, which will increase my guard heat.But overall it's a great game, and it's in Early Access so there's still loads to be added. I'm exited for any further release.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 13, 2015
												Sit Down and listen to my story of my Escape from Centre Perks, The most relaxing Prision known to man (Unless you see the end of a baton).How I Was Caught: Life was so simple, I was an escape artest for a team of highly train, extreamly agile, over level 9000, Ninja Like CowMen, My Name was BillyGoat. I was caught after i murdered and buch on ManBearPies with a roll of Duct Tape and plastic knifes. My first day of prison life begins.Day 1: Woke up with guards ring the bell for rollcall, My Name was called "Them Sheep" I Said in anger, first day and my name is call, well it luckly all I had in my desk was a toothbush, toothpaste and I don't know what else.Food Time, I love the taste of over cooked bland chicken that tastes of sawdust and comes fresh from a can, "Plastic Fork, These will be handy" I grab a few and looked for a sutable wall (Don't ask, just know it works).The Shower room was empty and for some reason guards were every dumb. I kept chipping at the wall till it broke into another block of wall (This is impossable right).I put the wall block and thought of my escape even more "I need knives... Plastic ones", I rushed back to the canteen and grabed a few (It was lucky, all I need four for my daring escape).Next step, Make a bed dummy... mmm two pillows and a blaket, that will work, the guards here have a memory of a goldfish and a attention span of another goldfish after finding out he was born.OK... put that one bed, make a rope. All I need for that is two bed sheets Nice.The cover of night fall.... Im Batman... Wait no, Correction.... The night rollcall of the annoying blasted bells rang of couse I get... no wait false alarm, I missed the shakedown, sod it its time to do the escape.I rushed to were the wall was broken.Up some random ladders,Used Rope to get to ground,and.....Day 2: Used the knives on the fence till it gave away.Then I walked out like some kina boss man, acting badass after a meeting about cakes,I turned around and saw the guards making tea, I casually walked in,Stole there donuts,and walked back out (Well I needed food for the walk I guess)End10/10 Would be put back into confiment agian...Wait a sec!!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								Here is my personal opinion/review for The Escapists. Please know that this is just from my own experiences and the game is still in early access.  Category Description Points   Graphics/Animations The graphics in this game are very simple (pixels), but very nice in the same sense. One thing that does bother me personally though is that everyone looks like they are constantly running. Even when they are sitting down they still look like they are running. 9/10   Gameplay This game isn't for everyone, with that being said, it takes a lot of time and planning to achieve a successful escape. Most of the time you will find yourself doing excercise to build strength and scavenging for materials. It is unique in many ways though and for these reasons I enjoy the gameplay. 8/10   Mechanics/Misc. The game's mechanics certainly aren't unique or complex, but they work nonetheless. Some aspects don't feel complete to say the least. Fighting mechanics are very basic, consisting of activating combat mode and then clicking your target which it will then automatically fight for you, winning/losing depending on your muscle and health. One big issue that I've found is how easy it is to escape from a fight. You can hit a guard and then if you just run away and get out of their sight for a few seconds they will forget about you. 7.5/10 Overall: 8/10 - Enjoyable but could be better.I overall enjoyed this game, but in it's current state, if you are interested it would be best to wait until the price is lowered. If you can get passed all of it's downsides in it's current state, go ahead and purchase this game.It has a lot of potential though, as it is only in early access.
