number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								I have been playing this game non-stop for the past few days after I've gotten off work, lets talk good, bad, and uglyGood: Game has potential, worth the price tag (currently at 10$US). The gameplay is simplistic but it keeps me coming back. It is a fun game all around, and some of the interactions have made me laugh.Bad: Game is almost too simplistic. What I mean by the prior is that, you do the same thing 40 times before you make any headway, which is fine, I understand that the game is in Early Access and it is for a reason, but at the same time, this point of the game development is strictly based around "Let's hope they just get lost in prison", because half my game time is structured around just doing usual prison crap. There isnt any gore which frankly bothers me, I stab a guy forty times with a shiv and it looks like im slapping him with my di**Ugly: Holy hot♥♥♥♥♥♥♥from hell there are spelling errors. The game is based out of the UK, which means "favor" is spelt "favour" these are not the spelling errors im referecing, in the general game itself when you speak to other inmates (of which there is almost little interaction) they say one of like.... 6 poorly spelt phrases and continue on their way, and it isnt meant to be misspelled for "hey its prison these people are stupid effect" it might've just been laziness with the devs..What Could We Do to Improve? Im not going to suggest mutliplayer like many others have, I would like to see more prisons, and a bit more strict time lines, I would also like gore and some sort of better violence, perhaps people get released, and new people come in, you might have to share a cell or something. But there are some serious bugs that need to be worked out. When someone punches me, and I punch someone in retailiation, and the cops only see me? I get wailed on for half an hour, and these guys just dont stop, they chase your♥♥♥♥♥all over, and if you go outside? "BOOM HEADSHOT", yes you get freaking sniped walking outside. Overall: This game is worth 10$ if it increases Do Not Buy. Bottomline, I have seen small development from this game, and I would like to continue seeing it. If the game becomes mutliplayer, I might just stop playing it all together.

												I enjoyed playing this game a lot. It's fun to find all the multiple ways to escape, many of which end in failure, but that in itself is funny enough to watch. If you miss rolecall then the entire prison will go into lockdown (just for little old you) and you'll get fired from your job too, which sucks.So all I should say is that it's a good game, and also everybody is obsessed with Duct Tape (thanks Martyn).

content:
Posted: March 10, 2015
												oh, the escapists. it's a love/hate relationship between you and me.you play as a little prisoner who was sent to jail for an unidentified reason, and you must collect materials to slowly, yet sneakily break out.the escapists is a prison simulator that can really test your ability to be sneaky and stuff. there are about 6 maps currently, which range between difficulty. the hardest, being HMP Irongate, that isbased on alcatraz. (You know, the prison on the island in san fransisco?)you can buy materials off of other prisoners too, but only with money, which can be earned by doing a favour for a prisoner (like beating up 'this' person) or doing your job.your prisoner starts off with puny stats, and you can improve these by going on a treadmill or doing push ups. Also going on the internet raises your 'intelligence' so you can craft better items and apply for better paying jobs.I really like this game, but i hope for more to it in the future.8/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 28, 2015
												When I first saw this game, I instantaniously knew I had to get it.  An 8-bit strategy game invloving its own crafting system and all about escaping prison.  Yeah, perfect ingredients for a great game.  Some Positives Here:-The crafting system is well designed and very simple (its just acquiring some of the materials that's the hard part).-The mechanics of the prisons are varied, in terms on jobs, indoors/outdoors, security, etc.-Diverse ways of getting out (some are exclusive to certain jails).-Just all around funOf course not every game is perfect:-I didn't like the update of having to complete sequential jails rather than just jumping right into one, I enjoyed occassionally jumping into Iron and realizing I have no idea what to do.-Minor glitches, but mostly forgivableBut overall it's a great game and anyone thinking about getting totally should.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20, 2016
The Escapists - ReviewOverview:The Escapists is an indie game, which puts you into the role of an inmate of various prisons, which, as the name implies, you'll have to escape. To do that, the game offers you a massive amount of options, not giving you any more guidance than a basic tutorial. This way one is - as it's fitting the setting - finding out possibilities, the schedule of the prison etc. to figure out a plan and slowly work towards the final goal: escape!The game basically sets up a world and it's rules, and within that you are completely free to act. If your plan now is to slowly dig a tunnel day by day, or start a riot and take over the prison - you are the one making the story happen.The game also offers a prison editor, therefore one can always download player-created prisons once they have beaten all the pre-included ones. GameplayWithin the prison you can both work or complete favors (in most cases beating up someone for someone else) to earn some money, with which you can buy items from inmates. Which items they sell is random, because of which sometimes you've got to wait quite a while to get specific items that you cannot get otherwise.I don't want to tell any more, since one of the fun sides of the game is finding out the mechanics, and slowly becoming an experienced escapee.Pros:Player driven gameplay -> The game basically offers a playground for the player to freely act on.Tons of content through prison editor and workshop compatibilityThe game is mechanically simple but forces the player to get creative on harder levelsCons:Can get grindy at timesConclusion:8/10 - Solid score, the game is very well executed, offers the player limitless possibilities, and forces one to think outside of the box, for what it feels very rewarding.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								I have been playing this game non-stop for the past few days after I've gotten off work, lets talk good, bad, and uglyGood: Game has potential, worth the price tag (currently at 10$US). The gameplay is simplistic but it keeps me coming back. It is a fun game all around, and some of the interactions have made me laugh.Bad: Game is almost too simplistic. What I mean by the prior is that, you do the same thing 40 times before you make any headway, which is fine, I understand that the game is in Early Access and it is for a reason, but at the same time, this point of the game development is strictly based around "Let's hope they just get lost in prison", because half my game time is structured around just doing usual prison crap. There isnt any gore which frankly bothers me, I stab a guy forty times with a shiv and it looks like im slapping him with my di**Ugly: Holy hot♥♥♥♥♥♥♥from hell there are spelling errors. The game is based out of the UK, which means "favor" is spelt "favour" these are not the spelling errors im referecing, in the general game itself when you speak to other inmates (of which there is almost little interaction) they say one of like.... 6 poorly spelt phrases and continue on their way, and it isnt meant to be misspelled for "hey its prison these people are stupid effect" it might've just been laziness with the devs..What Could We Do to Improve? Im not going to suggest mutliplayer like many others have, I would like to see more prisons, and a bit more strict time lines, I would also like gore and some sort of better violence, perhaps people get released, and new people come in, you might have to share a cell or something. But there are some serious bugs that need to be worked out. When someone punches me, and I punch someone in retailiation, and the cops only see me? I get wailed on for half an hour, and these guys just dont stop, they chase your♥♥♥♥♥all over, and if you go outside? "BOOM HEADSHOT", yes you get freaking sniped walking outside. Overall: This game is worth 10$ if it increases Do Not Buy. Bottomline, I have seen small development from this game, and I would like to continue seeing it. If the game becomes mutliplayer, I might just stop playing it all together.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2015
												The Escapists is a great, retro strategy game that is challenging, but satisfying. The thought of escape makes you nervous and excited. On the downside, there are lots of bugs, like if you have items in the toilet and then exit out, when you come back in, they are gone. Also, sometimes left-clicking on people with an "!" above there head doesn't do anything. It would be nice, as well, to be able to use the scroll bar to toggle through items in your inventory. It would also be amazing if there was an online co-op where you and your friends could escape prison together. Overall, a great game, but needs some improvements.

content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
												So, I tried playing it again after leaving during Early Access.After making butt loads of custom dialouge for my game (great change, btw) I actually got in and tried to beat the first Prison, Centerperks.As far as I can tell, the only way to escape prison is at night. The end of the day. If you attempt an escape at day, you'll be insta killed by all-seeing snipes placed everywhere. And this is Minimum Security? Anyway...My plan was to get a guard outfit using a contraband bag, crawl into the vents use my plastic utility key and make my way to the roof. I'd use a bedsheet rope to scale down the ceiling, and cut my way out. This is my first time playing this game, remember. I forgot to make a bed dummy, and the guards found my empty cell.So, I had to do the whole day over again, or have to do the entire escape plan over again.The whole day. So it ended up becoming everytime I found something useful for my escape, I waited for the end of the day so if I got caught, I wouldn't have to buy it from the RNG merchants again. Like, getting the contraband bag was huge hassle. The guards came after me, I got beat up and they took my bag. I had to spend two in game days trying to find a merchant to sell me the damn materials because they sell different stuff each time.Anyway! I failed my escape attempt, did the whole day over again. I went into the vents and was unscrewing the vent infront of the utility shaft to the roof. I would put down a stepladder to go back up and replace the vents so I wouldn't be teleported instantly to solitary confimement. (which is BS by the way. if they find anything wrong, you'll insta-lose and go to solitary and have to redo the whole day.)So, I was unscrewing the vent, unscrewed it and BOOM insta-lose. There just happened to be a guard walking by and saw the vent go up. I just realized that at night, you can't see what's under the vents like you can at day. I had already tried this escape plan 3 times before. First time I got to the roof, but they discovered my empty cell. Redo the day. 2nd time I forgot to get my guard outfit because I had waited the whole day last time. Redo the day. Third time, a guard jsut happened to walk by.So now, I have to hope that when I unscrew the vents, a guard wont walk by before I can replace it.Or else I'll have to redo the day.I AM SO SICK OF HAVING TO REDO THE DAY.The day's are long and boring once your escape plan is in place. If you mess up, it just becomes waiting until night-time simulator.This would all be fixed if I could quick-save. I'm a ♥♥♥♥ing noob at the game, and looking at walkthroughs for the "first day" escape or whatever is, in my mind, cheating.  Just let me quick save at night so I can try again. The people who are good at this game can do ironman mode or whatever but don't ♥♥♥♥ me.I got ♥♥♥♥ed so many times playing this game. If you wan't to buy this, make sure your plan is foolproof. How do you know it's foolproof? Either a)looking on the internet) (which I think is cheap) or b) trial and error). Trial and error, however, is punished.SO WHAT THE FOUR HEART SIGNS AM I GONNA DO!?How ever, the game is still fun for other reasons.Just really wish it had quick saving.

content:
Posted: February 3, 2015
												I bought this game while in early access and I am updating the review as this game has changed quite a bit. This game is a strategy game that requires timing, knowledge, and patience. You will not get through this game doing nothing but beating up guards. I played this game without looking at the wikipedia, and in my 50 or so hours I beat every normal prison, none of the DLC prisons, even though I own all of them, (Including Fort Bamford because I bought the game in Early Access). This game is worth the money just looking at the hours of playtime you get from it. Enjoyment is a different thing, not everyone will like the game. Foremost is graphics, it is a 2D top-down view, and the art style is very pixelated. However, this means you do not need a high end computer to run it. Most computers will be able to run this game as it is a lightweight program. The gameplay like I said earlier is very strategic and it requires a bit of luck with the patrol of the guards. You need an escape strategy and, depending on the prison, sometimes there is only one way out that requires specific items. Most items needed in escaping are contraband, they will be taken if seen by guards, and you will be reset if guards find any in your desk or find a hole in a wall or the ground. This makes for very chaotic gameplay, "Quick. move the desk, get in, dig dig dig, get out, place the desk!", that sort of thing.In conclusion I would reccomend this game, it is an amazing single player game and I definitely consider escaping some of those prisons as achievements.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6, 2015
												 Developed by Mouldy Toof Studios The Escapists places you in the role of a convicted felon trying to escape from prison. Prison games aren’t the most original of ideas right now, but there take on it is quite unique. It’s currently out on Early Access on steam, so expect bugs and issue’s if you take the plunge. The game has an 8bit style that’s reminiscent of the games on the NES and gives the game a really stylised feel. The Escapists isn’t afraid to poke fun at its self too, you’ll often find yourself chuckling at the odd line a guard says or an awkward moment in the showers. The main idea is of course to escape, but the game gives you a huge amount of choices on how to do that. Will you build a tunnel under ground, or pose as a guard? Will you climb into the ventilation system or chip through the walls? There is no set method and no dead set rules. But before you even think of escape there are other considerations. Prison life starts in the morning with role call, this is where you will find out who’s cell will be tossed. If its yours I hope you’ve not left any contraband or signs of escape for the guards to find as this will set you back to square one again, you’ll lose all you’ve worked so hard to acquire and all your holes and false walls will be filled in. After role call your day will be broken up into meal periods, exercise time, shower time and free periods/work periods. Through out the day you will be interacting with other inmates, buying items from them or taking jobs from them. These jobs range from acquiring for them a comb shiv to causing a distraction in the showers so your fellow inmates can dish out some rough justice. These jobs will improve your standing with said inmate and earn you money but might cause the victim to take a less positive view of you, eventually they may come looking for revenge. Guards that you’ve had run-ins with in the past might attack you on sight and leave you in the infirmary. You’ll find your constantly walking a popularity tight rope, it adds a nice dynamic to the game. Your inmate has three skills that he can improve too, strength is the first. Improving strength with bench presses or push ups will increase your health. Speed is the second, this is improved by running on a treadmill or other cardio workouts. This skill is strange as it doesn’t improve your movement speed but rather how fast you can attack. Lastly is your intelligence skill, Improved by browsing the web or other knowledge based ventures. This improves what you can craft and is perhaps the most important skill in the game. You may want to take the time to improve these skills to keep you alive long enough to put you escape plan into action. Don’t be fooled by the cute graphics or stylised charm of The Escapists, the game is not easy. It draws you in with a nice easy tutorial, but that’s it. After this you don’t get any help, your on your own. At times this can be infuriating, when you’ve been struggling for hours to put the perfect escape plan together only to be caught by a slight miss step. But! And its a big but, when you get it right its amazing. The game can be hard, but I can promises you that you’ll find yourself going back for more and more.For full review see http://cyberusuk.com/2015/01/27/the-escapists-review-should-it-be-kept-behind/

content:
Posted: October 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								I'll just get this out of the way, the game is a lot of fun. as a matter of fact, this game is so fun, it was NOMINATED for TIGA game of the year award. at the time of writing this review, "The Escapists" is only 2-3 months old.PROS-as i have said before, the game is fun-mostly kid friendly-combat is simple and easy, yet on the inside complicated, and I'll tell you why in just a sec-weapons are fairly balanced, and can only be made overpowered via work by you. You.-it is possible to make certain types of armor, worst being "Cushioned Inmate Outfit", which is easy to make and great for beginners, best being "Plated Inmate Outfit", which requires some hard work to make.CONS-EVERYTHING gets blamed on you. EVERYTHING. you stick a item called, no joke, "Dirt", not Pile of Dirt, which would make much more sense if you've seen the item, outside, and you will soon get a note which basiclly says "We know you tunneled, go to solitary" but here is the thing, you can find Dirt in other peoples desks! So you may not have created the item, but you get blamed for it.-Snipers. f***ing Snipers. if you do something that sets you all the way up to 99% guard heat, you'll soon notice that you were just running from the guards to being in the infirmary. Way too Powerful.-Bugs and Glitchs, which are common in Early Alpha, but i have met some very game breaking bugs, such as, having a inventory full of rare contraband and having all of it dissapear before my very eyes, etc.now you may be thinking "all of this and you're still recommending the game?" and the answer is, yes, yes i am.8 outta 10 amazing game and definetly worth $15. screw you large, repetitive games like CoD, I think I'll just sit by the fire and play some of this.

content:
Posted: February 8
												" It's funny. On the outside, I was an honest man. Straight as an arrow. I had to come to prison to be a crook.""I'd like to think that the last thing that went through his head, other than that bullet, was to wonder how the hell Andy Dufresne ever got the best of him.""Remember Red, hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things, and no good thing ever dies.""Get busy living, or get busy dying."" I have no idea to this day what those two Italian ladies were singing about. Truth is, I? don't wanna know. I would like to think they were singing about some thing was so beautiful it cant be expressed in words and make your heart ache because of it.I tell you this voice soared higher and farther than anybody in a Gray place dares to dream it is like some beautiful bird flapped into our drab little cage and made these walls dissolve away. For the briefest moment every last man in Shawshank felt free.""My God, Warden! How could you be so obtuse!""Not a day goes by I don't feel regret, and not because I'm in here or because you think I should. I look back on myself the way I was...stupid kid who did that terrible crime...wish I could talk sense to him. Tell him how things are. But I can't. That kid's long gone, this old man is all that's left, and I have to live with that.  Rehabilitated? That's a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t word, so you just go on ahead and stamp that form there, sonny, and stop wasting my damn time. Truth is, I don't give a♥♥♥♥♥♥"TLDR the quotesLadies and Gentleman, Boys and Girls!Introducing Shawshank Redemption the game!Stamp that purchase button there sonny and stop wasting your damn time reading reviews!

Posted: April 7, 2015
												this is one of the best games i have ever played. This game is super fun and dlc is in a reasonable price. In this game you go threw prisons trying to escape. Atfirst it is very confussing but as you go along it gets very simple. NO prison is repetative every prison offers new challedges and a new enviroment. Alcatraz is my personal favorite it even has the same layout of the actual alcatraz. There is no real cons with the game other than crafting notes are nessacaery to escape and if you dont get a bed dummy then your in trouble. Every day in the prison offercs something new. From favors such as beating up guards to stealing items its all fun. If you are confussed at all there is a help button when you hit escape wich is kind of like a inn game wiki. Even if i am just diving into this game i still absouluty love it. The schedual is one of my favorite parts every little thing matters skipping lunch and other stuff always always always have a job it is a good source of money building a crew is rewardeing aswell even if it is the hardest thing in the game to do. There is also a sence of acomplishment after each prison

												This is the tv show Prison Break with SNES graphics.Tutorial done in 3 minutes, good i understand the basics.First very easy level, pfft this should be done in 10 minutes.5 hours later...ARGH, They caught me again!This game is awesome, it thought of everything.I've been buying many new games recently.Steam is plagued with incomplete games made by trashy developpers trying to make a few bucks.This is not one of them.This is by far my best purchase.I can't imagine someone buying this and regretting it.Buy it now.Especially if you're browsing for any cool game and you're unsure which one will be worth the most.Trust me, this is the one.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 6, 2016
												I dont really feel like writing a big review for this game (at least yet), so I'm just gonna give a pros and cons list:Pros:-Nice looking graphics-Requires careful planning to escape-You can make a gang of people that follow your orders-Customizable names of inmates and guards, which can make the game pretty funny (although whenever I rename people there are many bugs such as multiple people spawning with the same name and people not spawning with the correct name)-Various different ways to escape each prison-System of buying items from other inmates-You can get a job to earn money and sneak contraband items out-Takes a while to escape, so you feel satisfied when you doCons:-No way to escape with the help of fellow inmates(as in, have other inmates help dig tunnels and stuff like that)-No multiplayer-No way to sell items to other inmates-No way to save the game until you go to sleep at night (so if you get a ton of stuff done during a day but have to go or somehow get caught before night you have to redo everything you did that day)Overall, I'd say it is a good game, but wait for it to go on sale to buy it.

content:
Posted: March 28, 2016
												These types of games usually greatly apeal to me, tedious planning and working towards a goal slowly, I can do that for hours.This game didnt feel like that, its just felt...boring. There feels like there is almost no depth, the entire game is grinding your stats with tedious button mashing, and collecting/crafting items. You cant incite riots, or team up with other inmates to work towards a plan. You cant pickpocket guards or inmates, the only way to steal things is beat the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of them, and when a guard wakes up, they automatically catch you. Your best hope is just hoping that a inmate is selling the contraband you need to progress your plan.When I finally gave up, after being automatically teleported to solitary again (No manhunt states or anything, just teleport you when they know you are up to no good) I was a little bummed when I realized I probably couldnt refund the game, as it felt like I had been playing it for upwards of 4 hours.I had been playing for about 1 hour...its the anti-civilization.I cannot recomend this game, not for nearly 20$ I feel Prison Architects slightly broken "in there just for fun" escape mode, has more depth than this.

content:
Posted: March 28, 2016
												Playing in the first prison only shortly after having completed the tutorial, I figured a screwdriver would be my best friend and the vents would be my best method for escape/transit in the wee hours of the night. I finally got my hands on a screwdriver from some chump in the showers and waited until lights out to begin my exploring. Got the vent popped off, headed towards the infirmary with my eyes on the chest, assuming their would be lots of drugs and needles and other prison goodies hopefully guaranteeing my success in #prisonlife. I dropped down only to be met with an inability to open the chest, as well as an inability to leave the room. At all. Guards see my cell is empty, place goes on lockdown, apparently no guard could figure out I was in the infirmary so Mr. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Warden MD Ph.D "calls in the big dogs" to sniff be out and I end up in SHU, losing my once invaluable screwdriver. I then dig a tunnel under the fence and flip the entire level the bird.Fast forward to the 3rd prison, I decide to get serious. No matter what I do these ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s figure out I broke into a vent, so we're giving up on that. Tunnels are the way to go. Minecraft trained me for this. The original Red Faction trained me for this. Ez Pz get a shovel and we're squeezy. I build up as much metal and duct tape as I can, rek that bummy Aiden from the woodshop so I have an easy supply of timber for braces, then get working on two sturdy shovels, a sturdy pickaxe, and keeping my toilet full of timber braces. The night comes. I've kept cool for 6 days now, I've got all the bars in my room covered and a bed dummy just incase. I start digging. I get under the floor. I continue digging towards the closest fence, only to realize I just dug up into my own cell and now my cell practically has no floor and I have nothing to cover it with. I get back into one of my holes to figure out what the ♥♥♥♥ is going on, when I realize I dug into an endless abyss from which I could indeed escape the prison, absolutely no digging required. This game makes no sense.10/10

content:
Posted: November 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								Well, the 999th review. This game is pretty dank. It's a lot of fun, provides constant updates from the great developers, and is definitly worth the money. With every alpha game, there are bugs, but it is rare to find any game breaking bugs. Some bugs are quite funny: in the jungle compound, randomly, everyone gets KO'd and you can run around and loot them all :3 the only bug so far that has genuinily annoyed me is a bug with the leaderboards, in which it will not update your days taken to escape if you get a faster escape on that prison. I escaped in 8 days from the jungle compound, and then later on escaped with 4, but it only updated my score and not my days taken :( Anyway, I would recommend this game greatly!

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												(there will be misspells, sorry)                      The Escapists is a great game and defianatly worth the money, i think it is sort of an uplifting game with stratagey and excitment. You have jobs, inmate's and guard's Al is awesome, and there are many different prisons. The prisons go from easy to hard and there are 6 of them, the DLC prisons arw great too. Inmates can ask you favors to get a specific item for them, a distraction at a certain time, and beat up someone. Your inmates also can sell things that you need to escape. Of all singleplayer games out there, i would rate this one as the best.                                                                                                                                                                        45/10 MR.Ca$h approves :)

												Well it is a great game in many ways, it also lacks in many ways.It's a lot of fun to escape in different ways each time, but there is one MAJOR problem:Guards can detect you trying to escape in ways they would never be able to IRL, but on the other hand you can get away with methods that would never work IRL either.Guards announce a cell search during role call? Run off to your cell while they talk and fit your pickaxe, shovel, guard uniform, and cell key in your pockets! Well this review probably is harsh, I am giving the benefit of the doubt that these sorts of things will improve over time. That, and as I said before, the replayablity makes it worth the cons (pun intended.)

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 9, 2016
												Prison escape is a fun premise for a game but the way it's executed in this game is lacking. You find yourself locked in a jail and spend a lot of your days trying to sneak away from your daily routines to scout for weak points in the jail's security. After you find some you'll need to craft some tools to use in your escape -- if you can find the required components. Every day you can purchase or steal items off of fellow inmates, but the items available are randomly generated! Meaning you normally have to play through several days just waiting for somebody to have a chocolate bar on them because that's the one item you need. It would be much better if you could request the basic items you need from inmates instead of them being completely random.Ploting your escape is fun. Repeating the same in-game routine over and over until a basic item becomes available for you to use is not. Unfortunately, I spent the majority of my time doing the latter.

content:
Posted: August 3, 2016
												This game is a lot of maintenance, a lot of RNG, and very little pay-off.  Everything that happens is highly-transient.  Buff yourself out?  Better spend a lot of time lifting weights, or you'll get weak.  Got a shiv?  You'll lose it when you get beat up, when your cell gets searched, or when someone else's cell gets searched.  Good luck getting the key you need; it'll vanish as soon as the guard wakes up--whoever's desk you hide it in, they get searched the next day about 80-90% of the time.As for how to play?  Just beat people up, steal their stuff, lift weights for half the time, and get beat up to clear all the negative stuff.  You'll spend most of your time trying to find one item (a screwdriver or a key).  You can get a job for money, if you want to spend 4 hours of gameplay getting $20; or you can spend 40 seconds lifting weights, then beat up inmates for other inmates.  You could craft a weapon, or just weight lift a hell of a lot.It's a lot of doing nothing.

content:
Posted: June 13, 2015
												This is actually a really fun game, and a fantastic premise - you are an inmate with grandiose dreams of escaping prison, and it's your task to spend your days observing prison life and stockpiling the resources you'll need to actually do it. I really enjoyed the time I spent with it, but I seem to have a bug which ruins the game for me.Whenever I reload from a previous state - whether in game, or when I come back to my computer and load the game up fresh - everything except the day I have saved on resets. Any items I have stashed away disappear, regardless of whether I leave them in safe or non-safe places (yep - all desk items simply vanish), all of the crafting notes I have collected are removed from the notebook, and anything my player was carrying (both in terms of equipped weapon and the 6 inventory slots) either randomises or disappears entirely. Sometimes items will randomly reappear on other unconscious inmates, but that's about it. The only things actually "saved" when saving the game seems to be my stats, and the tasks saved on my to-do list.If this pretty essential feature worked, I reckon I'd be quite a fan of The Escapists and recommend it as one of the most interesting indie titles I've ever come across. There is little to no hand-holding in this game which I especially love about it - you are literally left on your own to observe, explore, discover and devise. But if all my hard work observing, exploring, discovering and devising is going to be wiped any time I come back to the game (or even simply reload the day with the game still running!), I'm afraid I couldn't actively recommend this to anybody.Update: Heard from a friend that this bug was "fixed", so uninstalled and re-installed the game only for essentially the same things to happen again. Everything I've stockpiled disappeared. And I'm never warned or given solitary time, so I can say with certainty that it is the game itself and not the guards clearing those areas which is the problem. I don't mind that you can't save until the very end of the day; I can deal with that. But simply having everything as it was at point of saving should really be a given for a save feature... so this will sadly remain a downvote. A real shame, as I love the gameplay itself.

number of helpful: 27 of 53 people (51%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 9, 2015
												Games that expect you to use a wiki to figure everything out are not my thing, and the systems in this game are designed in a way that makes me feel gross.You find crafting recipes or buy them with character-specific dollars, and your "crafting recipes found" journal is per-character. This makes me feel like I have no progression because I want to start a new character if I end up hating the layout of the loot and how I've done on my current character and I always start from square 1 with the crafting stuff.There is only one prison until you beat that first one, and beating the first one is a hell of a task. This means if you ♥♥♥♥ up on the first one 25 times and start to get sick of the exact same routines and level layout every time you are SOL unless you manage to beat it or play the other two, much harder prisons that are unofficial.The fullscreen on 16:9 monitors is just the normal aspect ratio of the game stretched grossly wide, like an emulator set to stretch an NES game to 1080p that makes Mario twice as fat. It's really terrible and is the only option.The emergent gameplay of the prison is minor and less deep than it seems at the outset. You can easily knock out any prisoner by hitting them once and then running them into a guard while they chase you, let them hit you once and then the guard beats them to unconsciousness. You can make people miss their quota for their job by beating them up a bunch during work hours and then take their job. You can plant contraband in their cells. You can make people hate you and then coax them into fighting you and use them to cause a distraction or go somewhere they wouldn't. These things are kind of cool. But not enough to base a game around.If you fight a guard, all you can do is knock them out for 30 seconds, and if you take one of their keys they immediately game over you when they wake up. Also, if you run away after beating them up sometimes they just forget, sometimes there is no repercussion, sometimes they chase you around forever, and sometimes an unseen sniper in the corner of the map will shoot you in the face until you die. Which of these four things happens is decidedly random.Escaping, the whole point of the dang game, sucks. Digging is this awful minecrafty thing where you have pickaxes or pickaxe-like items that very quickly decay as you use them to dig through a foot of dirt, and then when they break you have to go get more. Tools you need desperately are either totally randomly found, difficult to craft with no way to figure out how the recipes work, which have some amount of sense, but, come on, paper meche = toilet paper & super glue? People who have played the early access version rattle off absurd, stupid crafting items like a "bed decoy" and 'fake vent cover" that just scream that the game's systems are buried so deep in their own BS that they feel the need to overdesign to cover their own flaws. Why build a game where you need three tiers of pickaxes and bed roll decoys and cell curtains and instant death snipers? Silliness.Vital items are hidden in one-time random loot crates that disappear forever after finding them and can contain garbage or incredibly valuable things and the seed changes every time you load so you have to save scum if you want something in particular.Oh and all the text stuff is all over the place in grammar and spelling, full of memes and nonsense most of the time, and you read it all within the first few hours. Sure there's some neat ideas but pulled off in a way that feels very mediocre.I still find myself coming back and might revise this review. It's kind of fun in some ways but just so frustrating.

content:
Posted: January 27, 2015
Early Access Review
[Day: 1]Aw well, saw it coming a mile away...Mikey stuck me up for an apparent 'murder' which I did not commit. The evidence looked solid but wasn't true, well we'll see how he likes it when I get out of here and give him a suprise visit...[Day: 5]Thank god the guys here are friendly, seems the prison is filled with crackjobs but heck they sure do give a guy what he needs. Met a guy called Spy, nice french guy gotta' admit. He's been supplying me with some goodies to help me outta' this dump. Should be out in a week or so at this rate.[Day: 7]Weakened the vent in my cell and I'm rather suprised nobody has heard me unscrewing the damn thing. Unfortunetly my plan can't go yet, nobody has had any supply of ducktape in a while so I've gotta' lay low for a few days before I can put my plan into full flow.[Day: 15]Spy has went quiet and hasn't been supplying noffin' seems the other inmates have it in for him. A lot of the other lads keep asking me to pummel the guy for dosh...Poor lad, might have to.[Day: 32]Seriously...No duck tape yet.[Day: 45]JESUS HOW HARD IS IT TO BRING IN CONTRABAND DUCK TAPE!? They can bring in drugs and knives but they can't even bring in freakin' ducktape!?! You know how hard it is to eat something that feels like dried concrete powder going down your throat? PRETTY DAMN HARD! Starting to lose it...[Day: 50]Attempted escape plan without the shovel...Improvised with a plastic spoon I took during evening meal. Ended up taking a full sniper shot to the leg, spending time in the medical room...[Day: 52]...I give up, I'll spend the next 6 years of my sentence waiting for ducktape.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2015
												This game constantly keeps you on your toes as to where you store your red items. Red items are contraband and get you in trouble! While grinding skills is part of the game, the routine system discourages this so you've always got something productive to do, unless you wanna get in trouble.Don't get this game unless you research prison life ahead of time through Jacksepticeye, videos in the community hub, or the wiki. It's important to know what's required of you, and the last thing you want to do is waste time, since time spent in the slammer is accounted into your final score.I escaped Center Perks by cutting through the fence at night wearing a guard outfit after spending a few days bulking up to knock out a cop to replicate his key to get outside after Lights Out. I think for the next jail, I'll be digging a long tunnel under my desk because electic fences seem problematic.10/10 would call the escape hotline to be notified of the electric fence again.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								I have to say, I've never been as tense in a 2D, top down game than I was during lights out, frantically trying to unscrew the vent cover above my cell, my fake vent cover made from the blood sweat and tears of countless fruitless searches through inmates desk's in search of super glue, terrified that at any moment a guard would pass by and all my progress would be lost.And then the release of breath I hadn't known I was holding as I crawled into the vent and hid my file. Even after realizing I had damaged my fake vent cover by putting it down and picking it back up after leaving the vents to return to my cell was but a minor setback in my first true and major victory.TL;DR: This game is friggin' radical.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								As the game currently is, it is prone to swings of luck and can feel a bit grindy. Not to mention that a single bad luck or mistake can dramatically cripple your progress so far and set you back tremendously and I'm only talking about prison of "moderate" difficulties (harder ones are not yet implemented). But all of this make success all the more satifying.It's a quirky game with it's own charm. It certainly can make the blood of rage quitters boil. But those who welcome games that can be harsh at times will become obcesed with pulling off that perfect escape and grabing that high score. Sinking many hours in this doing so.This is only an early access game and should not be judged as a full release. But I have to say that what the game already have is pretty decent and makes me hopeful for it's future.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20, 2016
												I bought this game in early access and I liked it, I really did. However, once it became a "full release" I really lost intrest. Much like "Pixal Piracy" it saying that it's done just kills it.So there I was thinking "Oh, they're not goining to fix the annoying instant solitary system and implement somthing that would show effort and really add to gameplay" and "So the leveling up system of clicking in place and maching Q and E till your wrists hurt is what they intended, and not just filler to get the game off of the ground" and "Oh, they're not going to add in more quips so you don't hate every line of dialoge after an hour" and "Oh, so they're not going to make a multiplayer mode that this game has been crying out for". I was just left feeling sad and angry.It is a fun game and I love the concept, the open ended levels give a great sense of freedom and you can escape however you like. But if you are on the roof or in vent or even in a tunnel, they should at least make it so that you aren't instantly caught if you happen to have a key stolen off of a guard or miss roll call. It sets itself up incredibly but through sheer laziness misses the mark tragically.And flipping heck the DLC takes the cake. The game isn't done, and it certainly isn't looking for a Walking Dead (tm) crossover that costs more than the actual game. PS:By instantly caught I mean that a window pops up and you get teleported to solitary immidiatly

content:
Posted: October 4, 2016
												I will say I can see why people see it's fun...on the other hand it's not so much fun. Escaping is the perfect chore, as you need to complete other chores in order to get the stuff to even start trying to escape. It seems to heavily lean on the 'trial and error' weed around. The worst part is half the time I don't have a clue of what I'm doing...and are no hints. The tutorial was more of an intro, and I'm frustrated the entire time playing it, without a fun moment to be seen.In other words, it looks fun, is for a lot of people, but not for me. In short, I can not recommend it.

content:
Posted: March 5, 2015
												I'd like to start off by saying I really wanted to like this game.A cool prison sim, yay. But unfortunately it's more than that.Here are some things that I find ridiculous about the game:1. If you accidentally dig in someone else's cell with a SPOON, somehow the warden will link it back to you and you will lose all your items :D!2. If you take a guard's key, they will somehow "link it back" to you, and you will lose all your items :D.3. If you're digging and you leave the hole behind, they will somehow "link it back" to you, and you will lose all your items :D!4. To dig out of the prison, you need to use Timber Supports, which take 2 timer per square -- I'd like to add that timber is very rare to find in someone else's desk, and no one sells them...5. Things like Paper Mache Cell Vents have odd durability, so you can only use them like 5 times before they break...I really wanted to like this game, I really did. But it's gotten to the point where I'm still on the 1st ♥♥♥♥ing prison and I keep having to reset my game because it's LINKED BACK TO ME.5/10, would not play again

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								Thoroughly enjoyable in its current state, "The Escapists" is a puzzle game that tasks you with escaping a prison.  It features a crafting system and a number of safe/contraband items to loot.  There's a relatively moderate learning curve, though this is offset by the in-game help menu and recipe tracker (which I'm thankful for).  I had a lot of fun trying to figure out how to escape while observing the day to day routine whilst leveling up your character's stats, though I was prone to accidentally punching people in the face due to how easy it is to switch to combat-click mode.  You can find it on Steam's Early Access program for $9.99 with a price increase scheduled later down the line.


YouTube™ Video: DGA Plays: The Escapists (Ep. 1 - Gameplay / Let's Play)

content:
Posted: February 5
												I can understand why people like this game. The simplistic, pixellated graphics - look really good - at least in windowed mode. The concept of escaping from a number of prisons using nothing more than your wits (and what you get in your drawer. And what you get from doing favours) is brilliant in theory. The soundtrack adds to the feel of the game. But The Escapists, for all of its successes and positive press, is not without its shortcomings. For me, when I first picked up the game, my first thoughts were "Is this seriously the loading screen..." and "How do I get this into fullscreen?" After fixing the settings and starting the game, I found that the graphics, which seemed to be stretched to fit the entire screen, made the squarish tiles seem rectangular, the text seem stretched and all of the characters seem out of proportion. The text boxes that appeared over the characters' heads didn't add to the aesthetic either - they just seemed like people yelling out the same random drivel day after day - no conversation, no dialogue, no nothing.The gameplay did nothing for me either. The tutorial was just enough to explain the basic controls, which felt unnatural to me. Clicking on things to interact with them but requiring (or at least showing) WASD to move felt like it was a bit of a nuisance to move the cursor every time I wanted to even so much as look at my desk - not to mention how easy it was to accidentally pick it up and annoy the guards - but the gameplay itself to me felt very grindy, with little payoff and no sense of progression. After the first few days in the first prison, I felt that I was getting nowhere, had no clue what I was supposed to be doing, and was just repeating the same day over and over with no real way of going forward (which the tutorial should have explained.) It was just a matter of: Get up. Stand in one spot for a few seconds. Go and move to a room and sit in the same spot. Look for people to trade with. Do the laundry. Go and spam some buttons. Stand in the same spot for a few seconds. Look for trades again. Go and sit in a certain spot. Go and stand in a certain spot. Go to bed. Repeat.Once again, I feel like this was a good concept, poorly executed for a PC game. I would be fine with it as a premium mobile experience, but I feel like it is a bit simple for a $20 PC game.

content:
Posted: March 22, 2016
												Great im going to try give an accurate guide on how to escape the first prison (very easy)1. train up your HP to 100% (untill your hp is 50) 2. train your intellect a bit3. get a metalshop job (this is the job you get paid most for) 4. fill your desk with forks and knives get a screw driver too 5. move your desk so you can climb the vent in your cell 6. at night time use the knives to weaken the vent to 5% durability (dont let the guards see) use your scredriver to finish off the vent (it should appear in your inventory) make sure to place a bed dummy (this is really important) cover up the vent too7. search for loot8. steps 4 5 6 and 7 were optional so if you don't want to bother you dont need to 9. get 2 pieces of timber and some green wire 10. craft nunchucks (powerfull weapon)11. get some rope 12. get a guard outfit 13. during free time knock out guards when they are alone and strolling by themselves14. tie them up with the rope 15. knock out all the guards you can16. tie them up with rope if you have some 17. you should get a letter from the warden about the main gate being open18. put on the guard uniform19. walk through the front gate like a boss20. you've escaped and should've got a achievement have fun guys ;)

content:
Posted: December 14, 2016
InstallationThe game is a very small file, which is expected of an 8-bit game. It took me less than a minute to install. It does use a launcher though, which is quite annoying.GameplayThe objective of this game is to escape from a prison (as you probably guessed). There is a routine that you must follow (like  roll call, breakfast, job/leisure period, etc). Whilst doing this, you must collect items that will help you escape from the prison. There is a lot you can do, and some pretty cool hidden features. There are currently 6 main prisons, with a bonus 8.Final ThoughtsThis game is definitely a must-have for those who love puzzle/escaping games. For 15 dollars, the price is a bit steep, so you should wait for a sale before purchasing. Below is a list of pros and cons:Pros- Great game mechanics and features- 8-bit style game- Active community- Replayability- Steam Community WorkshopCons- Only able to save after a full day has passed, which is several minutes long- Repetitive dialogue- Somewhat unreasonable priceIn conclusion, this is an excellent prison escape game, with its major setback being the price. -8/10

content:
Posted: December 14, 2016
												When I bought the Escapists, I was hooked. The initial reward is very fun, exploring the first prison increasing relations, collecting items, and stepping out of line. It all culminated in my daring escape plan which involved simply collecting cutlery and cutting through walls and fences. I then moved on to the next prison, and as it turned out it was as simple as... collecting cutlery and cutting through walls and fences.You'll love the first 1-2 hours and dread the monotony of the rest of the game. It's incredibly repetitive and lacks enough depth (even with its incredibly difficult prison maker). Get prison architect instead- it'll last far longer.Pros:-Great concept-Fun first few hours-Great humour and visualsCons:-Very repetitive-Not much depth5.5/10

content:
Posted: October 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								♥♥♥♥ing love this game. But god do I hate it.It's one of those games, really good, but has it's flaws. But those flaws, are somehow, sometimes, enjoyable.I definately suggest getting this game, as it's very fun. But if you get mad easy, avoid this like the plague.Update: The game feels like it intentionally tries to ♥♥♥♥ you over for no real good reason.I.E. Unlocked door led to you. Even though it's the second day and you don't even have a plastic key, nor did you open♥♥♥♥♥♥up yet.Inventory mysteriously disapearing, but game still registers it as if it's still there, losing clothes, getting yelled at for not having clothes even though there's a person without clothes right next to you, going to steal jail clothes from the laundry, then for some odd reason having heat go to 100% immedietly as you leave the laundry room, getting shot by snipers, because you dared to get some clothes like they demanded.Stuff randomly repairing itself, random cell raiding, getting punched, then getting in trouble, Punching a guard, then getting shot with a ♥♥♥♥ing sniper rifle, seems a bit excessive but whatever.Essentially, annoying Alpha elements that hold the game back in it's current form. I don't reccomend buying it YET, As soon as it hits Beta, I'd suggest buying it then. Still a fun as hell game, just being held back by bugs and minor annoyances. Buy if you want to support development, till then, the fun is being held back, trust me. Great game, just wait a lil while.The Devs are really fricken cool though, seriously, I would buy this game just to help them out.

content:
Posted: April 10, 2015
												I'll start this review with the positives of this game. The Escapists does a few things very well: the dialogue, the crafting, and the prison layouts. However, the negatives greatly overweigh the positives. This game has a significant amount of grinding, and just pressing q and e to raise your players stats. The creators of this game could have tried to make a more engaging way to raise your characters statistics, but they failed at their attempt. Another complaint that I have is that the quests that other inmates give you are bland and boring. "Beat this guy up", "Someone stole my Pedicure Kit". It is extremely repetitive and gets old real fast. I would not reccomend this game, and at the steep price that it comes in at, I would not reccomend it even more.

												Clever title worth a few hours of fun, but not eighteen bucks worth.  Overpriced for the amount of content offered.  The prisons tend to be limited in scope.  The challenge lies not in your skill or cleverness, but in the amount of patience you have.  Sometimes you must wait days for an ingredient to become available.  You engage in lots of trial and error, little challenge really.  Pick it up on sale, under ten would be worth it.  Spend the twenty on an older game from a big developer you’ve not played yet.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 14
TL/DR REVIEWThis game has a lot of potential for me, but makes great misses on the way that ruin the fun. This game offers a lot of freeding, no hand holding in this game! You are on your own to try and figure your way out. The process for every level/prison is pretty much the same. Get items, avoid guards and then escape. Even though this can get repetitive after a while, there is not set in stone path to escape which gives keeps it interesting. There is some unfairness in this game that ruined it for me though. There is RNG of the item finding, which is not that bad but a little irritating. Most importantly, when you get caught with even a minor offence, the WHOLE MAP will be wiped clean! Had a fist fight with another inmate? Too bad. Now your secret stash of supplies and tools you carefully hid in a vent are gone! GONE! If you are willing to look past this, get the game, it's great (trust me)! But for me, it got stale after a couple hours.Final noteThis is not an in depth or complete review of the game. It simply sums up my experience with the game in an effort to help you make a more informed purchasing decision.

content:
Posted: January 24
												This game is one of the greats.Your stuck inside a prision and you have to escape. The Prisions are tough to break out of and the crafting is hard. You need to stick to your daily routines or the guards get angry. You need to be patient with this game so you can plan your escape.Center Perks:Center Perks is the easiest prision to escape from. No one hates you and the guards are quite nice. You start with the laundry job which can acesses you to the guards outfit. A tip is that you should never dig in an open space. The guards will find you. Another tip is to cover your tracks. It helps if you don't want to go to solitary. This Prison is is a really easy one to escape. The fact that it has an open space is good. The Tower Guard Locations are also really well done.Stalag Flucht:This Prision is a big leap from Center Perks. The guards are suddenly meaner and less people like you. For this Prision your going to need a lot of Strength to take down guards. The Plastic Red Staff Key always helps. For this you learn that the Blue fence = Electrical. What I like about this Prision is it appears to be hard but its quite well designed and easy to escape from.Shankton State Pen:This Prision is the first really indor prision. It has increased Contraband detectors so its not easy to smuggle things. My reccomendation is that you get a lot of Contraband Pouches and the Woodshop job. This Prision was well made with the interior. The fact that it has extra security but not much is goodJungle Compound:The Jungle Compound has a medium of security. The Guards go everywhere except for a few locations. My tip for this Prision is to stick to your routine and try to escape every chance you have. What I like about this Prision is the fact that is has only one way to escape which is by getting ID Papers. I alos like how there is a Perimiter Jeep which can be quite annoying if you aren't careful.San Pancho:This Prision is tough. Barley any Camea's and Few Contraband Detectors but its tough. This Prision isn't nice to you. Only 4 Guards ever enter. The three for the Rollcall ect and one for desk searching. All the Prisioners hate you completely and want to kill you. There are lots of fights and guards don't help. My tip is getting the Tailor Job, Break the wall infront then dig until you reach the Concreat. What I like about this Prision is how it introduces a Prision with seemingly no guards. I also like how you get to experience the annoyingness of mines. (The Music is great)HMP Irongate: HMP Irongate is a hard Prision to escape from. There are a lot of Camera's and a lot of Contraband Detectors. You get barley any free time. What I like about this Prision is the fact that it goes from not much security to massive security. If you want to escape your going to need to work hard.Hope you enjoyed my review! Overall. Great Game.-Hyper | jskerritt

content:
Posted: July 22, 2016
												Read more negative reviews or watch some gameplay video before buying this game.Mostly a let down, it doesnt simulate anything very well and nothing is explained. I played it to long to get a refund but most of my time on it was not having fun. I might try to continue going to see if it gets better as I learn more but so far it is very lack luster.Although it is claimed that there are lots of ways you co do things almost anything you try will fail due to illogical AIHere are some examples.All gaurds carry various keys but you can't pick pocket them and none of them go to the main gate.If you knock out a gaurd and take a key then run and hide, when he wakes up you will be magically teleported to solitary confinment without them finding you.Stashing contraban in another prisoners cell does not get them in trouble. Also no one can permantly die, you don't have an actual sentence or anything and there is no long term repercussions for good or bad behaivore just a bit a skill drop if you spend the night in solitary,It's hard to explain in text but the game just feels stifling and pointless.There is no shake downs or lock downs. You don't follow inmates in line or get marched around, really its all choas.you can spend the whole day hiding or doing something you not suppose to get caught and then hit a gaurd with a weapon and then just run in circles until your Heat level dies back down. Or just walk right past gaurds and go somewhere you shouldn't be and they just complain a little and do nothing until your heat is at 90% and again you can just run around in a circle and wait for it to die down to 89% and then just go back to where you should be.Nothing makes any sense in the game, like none of it is simulated. i could go on but really I have nothing good to say about this game except that maybe its a challange.Read more negative reviews or watch some gameplay video before buying this game.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
												A pretty cool little game where you find ways to cleverly escape from large prisons, that's pretty much the gist of it really. The graphics are appealing and the music is quite nice, the freedom you get is also very refreshing (For how much freedom you get in prison anyways). However the game itself gets very repetitive in the later prisons with it feeling like your escaping the same prison over and over again with more security and slight gimmicks which really make little difference. It's one of few games where I'd honestly suggest watching a walkthrough of it rather than playing it yourself, since on one hand it's fun to see all the crazy ways to escape, but on the other there were so many moments where I just felt I had spent entire in game days making zero progression. A fun game at first but sadly it's very hard to recommend.

Posted: February 22, 2016
												Really good game, a bit difficult for beginners.Pros:- Many different ways of escaping- Big variety of prison types in the workshop to continue playing even after beating the main prisons- Each new prison unlocked introduces a new option to escape- Really thrilling when escaping prisonsCons:- Very difficult for beginners- Tutorial doesn't demonstrate legitimate ways of escape- Some of the DLC packs are very easily escaped (I escaped alcatraz with nothing but 2 keys)- Some prisons take a long time to finishThe Escapists: The Walking Dead is almost the same thing, so I do not recommend buying the walking dead version.

content:
Posted: February 1
												Meh, pretty boring. It's a grind game masquarading as a puzzle game.  Also, $17.99 is an outrageous price. There's a trailer where we see the player craft a tool, dig a tunnel, open a vent, lift weights, read a book, and run on a treadmill.  That's about 90% of the content.  Unless you're a six-year-old, you will be tired of it in the first hour.  The trailer is designed to pique your curiosity.  Don't be fooled.EDIT: my girlfriend's little brother has been playing this game on my computer all weekend, and he loves it. He's an eight-year-old.

Posted: March 1, 2015
												An Amazing  Game with prisons and items made from insane events that actually happened for instance the 2nd prison in the game Stalag Flucht is based upon a POW camp in germany that british scientists escaped from during WWII and the prison HMP Irongate is nicknamed "the rock" and is actually based on the prison alcatraz surrounded by icy waters. Some of the games items are the raft you can make for the newest prison which although made out of balsa wood instead of the 160 raincoats used to escape Alcatraz is still a referance to the actual escape. You can even put blankets on the bars of your cell like in the Alcatraz escape!!! 10/10 I reccomend this game to anyone who likes things like prison architect or watching the escapes from the actual prisons Such a fun game!

content:
Posted: February 18, 2015
												The Escapists is a prison simulation game. Not for the impatient. The game is an incredible experience, full of new surprises to prevent you from escaping! The guards can be relentless, and sometimes you have to fight them for the keys! But make sure you make a copy of the key and return the original BEFORE he wakes up. The walls are breakable but cover the hole. The game is difficult, and I escaped 3 different prisons. If you are looking for a game that is enjoyable, challenging and a bit funny, buy this game! There are many ways of escaping, from digging under the walls to making copies of all the keys and cutting the fence. You can even steal guard outfits and walk outside at night! I rate this game 9.5/10

content:
Posted: May 4, 2015
												The Escapists is a fun 2D up-down gane about escaping prison (obviously). This game was a huge challenge for me considering that I get angry somewhat easily. It is a game about thinking. Planning out your escape is not easy, for you will be bombarded with obstacles such as, mines, walls, and my least favorite, ROCKS. Getting the basics is simple, friend your cellmates, buy materials, craft, craft, craft, break a wall down, hide the tracks, etc. Guards will get angered and in later prisons, way more easily. About a rough 25% consisted of me being chased by guards and then dying over and over. Yet thats the reason I love this game. Because all of the suffering it puts you through, it worth it to see the "YOU ESCAPED --------," screen. I would reccomend this game to anyone who likes a good challenge and is strategic. ;)

content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												Ah, The Escapists. As of right now, there's 2 games (for me) that have the potential to pull me away from Counter-Strike. They are Garry's Mod, and The Escapists.I'll start off by saying that I've never actually escaped from a prison. I'm terrible at this game, but i like exploring the prisons and discovering new items & poop like that. I like beating other prisoners up and stealing things from their desks.I don't want to say too much, because the game isn't finished. Let me just say, it's a very sound investment.9/10
